-- | Information about the contact channel that Incident Manager uses to

module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ContactChannelAddress

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactChannelAddress</a> smart constructor.
data ContactChannelAddress
ContactChannelAddress' :: Maybe Text -> ContactChannelAddress

-- | The format is dependent on the type of the contact channel. The
--   following are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:simpleAddress:ContactChannelAddress'] :: ContactChannelAddress -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactChannelAddress</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   on the type of the contact channel. The following are the expected
--   formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
newContactChannelAddress :: ContactChannelAddress

-- | The format is dependent on the type of the contact channel. The
--   following are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>

module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ContactChannel

-- | The method that Incident Manager uses to engage a contact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data ContactChannel
ContactChannel' :: Maybe ChannelType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactChannelAddress -> ActivationStatus -> ContactChannel

-- | The type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three
--   contact methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS</li>
--   <li>VOICE</li>
--   <li>EMAIL</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelArn:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that contains the contact channel.
[$sel:contactArn:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> Text

-- | The name of the contact channel.
[$sel:name:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> Text

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
[$sel:deliveryAddress:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> ContactChannelAddress

-- | A Boolean value describing if the contact channel has been activated
--   or not. If the contact channel isn't activated, Incident Manager can't
--   engage the contact through it.
[$sel:activationStatus:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> ActivationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ContactChannel'</a>, <a>contactChannel_type</a> - The
--   type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three contact
--   methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS</li>
--   <li>VOICE</li>
--   <li>EMAIL</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelArn:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_contactChannelArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the contact that
--   contains the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContactChannel'</a>, <a>contactChannel_name</a> - The
--   name of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryAddress:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_deliveryAddress</a> - The details that Incident
--   Manager uses when trying to engage the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activationStatus:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_activationStatus</a> - A Boolean value describing if
--   the contact channel has been activated or not. If the contact channel
--   isn't activated, Incident Manager can't engage the contact through it.
newContactChannel :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactChannelAddress -> ActivationStatus -> ContactChannel

-- | The type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three
--   contact methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS</li>
--   <li>VOICE</li>
--   <li>EMAIL</li>
--   </ul>
contactChannel_type :: Lens' ContactChannel (Maybe ChannelType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
contactChannel_contactChannelArn :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that contains the contact channel.
contactChannel_contactArn :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The name of the contact channel.
contactChannel_name :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
contactChannel_deliveryAddress :: Lens' ContactChannel ContactChannelAddress

-- | A Boolean value describing if the contact channel has been activated
--   or not. If the contact channel isn't activated, Incident Manager can't
--   engage the contact through it.
contactChannel_activationStatus :: Lens' ContactChannel ActivationStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ContactChannel.ContactChannel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ContactChannel.ContactChannel

module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ContactTargetInfo

-- | The contact that Incident Manager is engaging during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactTargetInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ContactTargetInfo
ContactTargetInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Bool -> ContactTargetInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact.
[$sel:contactId:ContactTargetInfo'] :: ContactTargetInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value determining if the contact's acknowledgement stops the
--   progress of stages in the plan.
[$sel:isEssential:ContactTargetInfo'] :: ContactTargetInfo -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactTargetInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   the contact's acknowledgement stops the progress of stages in the
--   plan.

module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Contact

-- | A personal contact or escalation plan that Incident Manager engages
--   during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContact</a> smart constructor.
data Contact
Contact' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactType -> Contact

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:displayName:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:contactArn:Contact'] :: Contact -> Text

-- | The unique and identifiable alias of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:alias:Contact'] :: Contact -> Text

-- | Refers to the type of contact. A single contact is type
--   <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
[$sel:type':Contact'] :: Contact -> ContactType

-- | Create a value of <a>Contact</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_displayName</a> - The
--   full name of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_contactArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_alias</a> - The unique and
--   identifiable alias of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Contact'</a>, <a>contact_type</a> - Refers to the type
--   of contact. A single contact is type <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an
--   escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
newContact :: Text -> Text -> ContactType -> Contact

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_displayName :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_contactArn :: Lens' Contact Text

-- | The unique and identifiable alias of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_alias :: Lens' Contact Text

-- | Refers to the type of contact. A single contact is type
--   <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
contact_type :: Lens' Contact ContactType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Contact.Contact
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Contact.Contact
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Contact.Contact
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Contact.Contact
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Contact.Contact
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Contact.Contact
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Contact.Contact


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Engagement

-- | Incident Manager reaching out to a contact or escalation plan to
--   engage contact during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEngagement</a> smart constructor.
data Engagement
Engagement' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Engagement

-- | The time that the engagement began.
[$sel:startTime:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time that the engagement ended.
[$sel:stopTime:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact.
[$sel:incidentId:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
[$sel:engagementArn:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Text

-- | The ARN of the escalation plan or contact that Incident Manager is
--   engaging.
[$sel:contactArn:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
[$sel:sender:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Engagement</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_startTime</a> - The
--   time that the engagement began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopTime:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_stopTime</a> - The
--   time that the engagement ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_incidentId</a> - The
--   ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_engagementArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_contactArn</a> - The
--   ARN of the escalation plan or contact that Incident Manager is
--   engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_sender</a> - The user
--   that started the engagement.
newEngagement :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Engagement

-- | The time that the engagement began.
engagement_startTime :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time that the engagement ended.
engagement_stopTime :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact.
engagement_incidentId :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
engagement_engagementArn :: Lens' Engagement Text

-- | The ARN of the escalation plan or contact that Incident Manager is
--   engaging.
engagement_contactArn :: Lens' Engagement Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
engagement_sender :: Lens' Engagement Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Engagement.Engagement
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Engagement.Engagement
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Engagement.Engagement
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Engagement.Engagement
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Engagement.Engagement
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Engagement.Engagement
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Engagement.Engagement


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Page

-- | Incident Manager engaging a contact's contact channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPage</a> smart constructor.
data Page
Page' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Page

-- | The time that the contact channel acknowledged engagement.
[$sel:readTime:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time the message was delivered to the contact channel.
[$sel:deliveryTime:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact channel.
[$sel:incidentId:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that Incident Manager engaged the contact channel.
[$sel:sentTime:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the page to the contact channel.
[$sel:pageArn:Page'] :: Page -> Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement that this page is part of.
[$sel:engagementArn:Page'] :: Page -> Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
[$sel:contactArn:Page'] :: Page -> Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
[$sel:sender:Page'] :: Page -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Page</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:readTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_readTime</a> - The time that the
--   contact channel acknowledged engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_deliveryTime</a> - The time
--   the message was delivered to the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:Page'</a>, <a>page_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the
--   incident that's engaging the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_sentTime</a> - The time that
--   Incident Manager engaged the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_pageArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the page to the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_engagementArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the engagement that this page is part of.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:Page'</a>, <a>page_sender</a> - The user that started
--   the engagement.
newPage :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Page

-- | The time that the contact channel acknowledged engagement.
page_readTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time the message was delivered to the contact channel.
page_deliveryTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact channel.
page_incidentId :: Lens' Page (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that Incident Manager engaged the contact channel.
page_sentTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the page to the contact channel.
page_pageArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement that this page is part of.
page_engagementArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
page_contactArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
page_sender :: Lens' Page Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Page.Page
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Page.Page
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Page.Page
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Page.Page
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Page.Page
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Page.Page
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Page.Page


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType
newtype ReceiptType
ReceiptType' :: Text -> ReceiptType
[fromReceiptType] :: ReceiptType -> Text
pattern ReceiptType_DELIVERED :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_ERROR :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_READ :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_SENT :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_STOP :: ReceiptType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.ReceiptType.ReceiptType


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Receipt

-- | Records events during an engagement.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReceipt</a> smart constructor.
data Receipt
Receipt' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReceiptType -> POSIX -> Receipt

-- | Information provided during the page acknowledgement.
[$sel:receiptInfo:Receipt'] :: Receipt -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel Incident Manager
--   engaged.
[$sel:contactChannelArn:Receipt'] :: Receipt -> Maybe Text

-- | The type follows the engagement cycle, <tt>SENT</tt>,
--   <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, and <tt>READ</tt>.
[$sel:receiptType:Receipt'] :: Receipt -> ReceiptType

-- | The time receipt was <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, or
--   <tt>READ</tt>.
[$sel:receiptTime:Receipt'] :: Receipt -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Receipt</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptInfo:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptInfo</a> -
--   Information provided during the page acknowledgement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelArn:Receipt'</a>,
--   <a>receipt_contactChannelArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the contact channel Incident Manager engaged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptType:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptType</a> - The
--   type follows the engagement cycle, <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>,
--   and <tt>READ</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptTime:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptTime</a> - The
--   time receipt was <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, or <tt>READ</tt>.
newReceipt :: ReceiptType -> UTCTime -> Receipt

-- | Information provided during the page acknowledgement.
receipt_receiptInfo :: Lens' Receipt (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel Incident Manager
--   engaged.
receipt_contactChannelArn :: Lens' Receipt (Maybe Text)

-- | The type follows the engagement cycle, <tt>SENT</tt>,
--   <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, and <tt>READ</tt>.
receipt_receiptType :: Lens' Receipt ReceiptType

-- | The time receipt was <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, or
--   <tt>READ</tt>.
receipt_receiptTime :: Lens' Receipt UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Receipt.Receipt
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Receipt.Receipt
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Receipt.Receipt
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Receipt.Receipt
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Receipt.Receipt
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Receipt.Receipt
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Receipt.Receipt


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag

-- | A container of a key-value name pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | Value of the tag.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Name of the object key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Value of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Name of the object key.
newTag :: Tag

-- | Value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | Name of the object key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target

-- | The contact or contact channel that's being engaged.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTarget</a> smart constructor.
data Target
Target' :: Maybe ChannelTargetInfo -> Maybe ContactTargetInfo -> Target

-- | Information about the contact channel Incident Manager is engaging.
[$sel:channelTargetInfo:Target'] :: Target -> Maybe ChannelTargetInfo

-- | Information about the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
[$sel:contactTargetInfo:Target'] :: Target -> Maybe ContactTargetInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>Target</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelTargetInfo:Target'</a>, <a>target_channelTargetInfo</a>
--   - Information about the contact channel Incident Manager is engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactTargetInfo:Target'</a>, <a>target_contactTargetInfo</a>
--   - Information about the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
newTarget :: Target

-- | Information about the contact channel Incident Manager is engaging.
target_channelTargetInfo :: Lens' Target (Maybe ChannelTargetInfo)

-- | Information about the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
target_contactTargetInfo :: Lens' Target (Maybe ContactTargetInfo)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target.Target
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target.Target
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target.Target
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target.Target
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target.Target
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target.Target
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target.Target
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Target.Target


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage

-- | A set amount of time that an escalation plan or engagement plan
--   engages the specified contacts or contact methods.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStage</a> smart constructor.
data Stage
Stage' :: Natural -> [Target] -> Stage

-- | The time to wait until beginning the next stage. The duration can only
--   be set to 0 if a target is specified.
[$sel:durationInMinutes:Stage'] :: Stage -> Natural

-- | The contacts or contact methods that the escalation plan or engagement
--   plan is engaging.
[$sel:targets:Stage'] :: Stage -> [Target]

-- | Create a value of <a>Stage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInMinutes:Stage'</a>, <a>stage_durationInMinutes</a> -
--   The time to wait until beginning the next stage. The duration can only
--   be set to 0 if a target is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:Stage'</a>, <a>stage_targets</a> - The contacts or
--   contact methods that the escalation plan or engagement plan is
--   engaging.
newStage :: Natural -> Stage

-- | The time to wait until beginning the next stage. The duration can only
--   be set to 0 if a target is specified.
stage_durationInMinutes :: Lens' Stage Natural

-- | The contacts or contact methods that the escalation plan or engagement
--   plan is engaging.
stage_targets :: Lens' Stage [Target]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage.Stage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage.Stage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage.Stage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage.Stage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage.Stage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage.Stage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage.Stage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Stage.Stage


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan

-- | The stages that an escalation plan or engagement plan engages contacts
--   and contact methods in.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlan</a> smart constructor.
data Plan
Plan' :: [Stage] -> Plan

-- | A list of stages that the escalation plan or engagement plan uses to
--   engage contacts and contact methods.
[$sel:stages:Plan'] :: Plan -> [Stage]

-- | Create a value of <a>Plan</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stages:Plan'</a>, <a>plan_stages</a> - A list of stages that
--   the escalation plan or engagement plan uses to engage contacts and
--   contact methods.
newPlan :: Plan

-- | A list of stages that the escalation plan or engagement plan uses to
--   engage contacts and contact methods.
plan_stages :: Lens' Plan [Stage]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan.Plan
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan.Plan
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan.Plan
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan.Plan
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan.Plan
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan.Plan
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan.Plan
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.Plan.Plan


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.TimeRange

-- | A range of between two set times
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data TimeRange
TimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> TimeRange

-- | The start of the time range.
[$sel:startTime:TimeRange'] :: TimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The end of the time range.
[$sel:endTime:TimeRange'] :: TimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeRange</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_startTime</a> - The
--   start of the time range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_endTime</a> - The end of
--   the time range.
newTimeRange :: TimeRange

-- | The start of the time range.
timeRange_startTime :: Lens' TimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The end of the time range.
timeRange_endTime :: Lens' TimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types.TimeRange.TimeRange


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Types

-- | API version <tt>2021-05-03</tt> of the Amazon Systems Manager Incident
--   Manager Contacts SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an Amazon Web
--   Services service.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You don't have sufficient access to perform this operation.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed to due an encryption key error.
_DataEncryptionException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Updating or deleting a resource causes an inconsistent state.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Request would cause a service quota to be exceeded.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was denied due to request throttling.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Unexpected error occurred while processing the request.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Request references a resource that doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype AcceptCodeValidation
AcceptCodeValidation' :: Text -> AcceptCodeValidation
[fromAcceptCodeValidation] :: AcceptCodeValidation -> Text
pattern AcceptCodeValidation_ENFORCE :: AcceptCodeValidation
pattern AcceptCodeValidation_IGNORE :: AcceptCodeValidation
newtype AcceptType
AcceptType' :: Text -> AcceptType
[fromAcceptType] :: AcceptType -> Text
pattern AcceptType_DELIVERED :: AcceptType
pattern AcceptType_READ :: AcceptType
newtype ActivationStatus
ActivationStatus' :: Text -> ActivationStatus
[fromActivationStatus] :: ActivationStatus -> Text
pattern ActivationStatus_ACTIVATED :: ActivationStatus
pattern ActivationStatus_NOT_ACTIVATED :: ActivationStatus
newtype ChannelType
ChannelType' :: Text -> ChannelType
[fromChannelType] :: ChannelType -> Text
pattern ChannelType_EMAIL :: ChannelType
pattern ChannelType_SMS :: ChannelType
pattern ChannelType_VOICE :: ChannelType
newtype ContactType
ContactType' :: Text -> ContactType
[fromContactType] :: ContactType -> Text
pattern ContactType_ESCALATION :: ContactType
pattern ContactType_PERSONAL :: ContactType
newtype ReceiptType
ReceiptType' :: Text -> ReceiptType
[fromReceiptType] :: ReceiptType -> Text
pattern ReceiptType_DELIVERED :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_ERROR :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_READ :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_SENT :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_STOP :: ReceiptType

-- | Information about the contact channel that Incident Manager uses to
--   engage the contact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelTargetInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelTargetInfo
ChannelTargetInfo' :: Maybe Natural -> Text -> ChannelTargetInfo

-- | The number of minutes to wait to retry sending engagement in the case
--   the engagement initially fails.
[$sel:retryIntervalInMinutes:ChannelTargetInfo'] :: ChannelTargetInfo -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelId:ChannelTargetInfo'] :: ChannelTargetInfo -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelTargetInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryIntervalInMinutes:ChannelTargetInfo'</a>,
--   <a>channelTargetInfo_retryIntervalInMinutes</a> - The number of
--   minutes to wait to retry sending engagement in the case the engagement
--   initially fails.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:ChannelTargetInfo'</a>,
--   <a>channelTargetInfo_contactChannelId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the contact channel.
newChannelTargetInfo :: Text -> ChannelTargetInfo

-- | The number of minutes to wait to retry sending engagement in the case
--   the engagement initially fails.
channelTargetInfo_retryIntervalInMinutes :: Lens' ChannelTargetInfo (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
channelTargetInfo_contactChannelId :: Lens' ChannelTargetInfo Text

-- | A personal contact or escalation plan that Incident Manager engages
--   during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContact</a> smart constructor.
data Contact
Contact' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactType -> Contact

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:displayName:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:contactArn:Contact'] :: Contact -> Text

-- | The unique and identifiable alias of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:alias:Contact'] :: Contact -> Text

-- | Refers to the type of contact. A single contact is type
--   <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
[$sel:type':Contact'] :: Contact -> ContactType

-- | Create a value of <a>Contact</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_displayName</a> - The
--   full name of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_contactArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_alias</a> - The unique and
--   identifiable alias of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Contact'</a>, <a>contact_type</a> - Refers to the type
--   of contact. A single contact is type <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an
--   escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
newContact :: Text -> Text -> ContactType -> Contact

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_displayName :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_contactArn :: Lens' Contact Text

-- | The unique and identifiable alias of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_alias :: Lens' Contact Text

-- | Refers to the type of contact. A single contact is type
--   <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
contact_type :: Lens' Contact ContactType

-- | The method that Incident Manager uses to engage a contact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data ContactChannel
ContactChannel' :: Maybe ChannelType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactChannelAddress -> ActivationStatus -> ContactChannel

-- | The type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three
--   contact methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS</li>
--   <li>VOICE</li>
--   <li>EMAIL</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> Maybe ChannelType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelArn:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that contains the contact channel.
[$sel:contactArn:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> Text

-- | The name of the contact channel.
[$sel:name:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> Text

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
[$sel:deliveryAddress:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> ContactChannelAddress

-- | A Boolean value describing if the contact channel has been activated
--   or not. If the contact channel isn't activated, Incident Manager can't
--   engage the contact through it.
[$sel:activationStatus:ContactChannel'] :: ContactChannel -> ActivationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ContactChannel'</a>, <a>contactChannel_type</a> - The
--   type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three contact
--   methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS</li>
--   <li>VOICE</li>
--   <li>EMAIL</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelArn:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_contactChannelArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the contact that
--   contains the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContactChannel'</a>, <a>contactChannel_name</a> - The
--   name of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryAddress:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_deliveryAddress</a> - The details that Incident
--   Manager uses when trying to engage the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activationStatus:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_activationStatus</a> - A Boolean value describing if
--   the contact channel has been activated or not. If the contact channel
--   isn't activated, Incident Manager can't engage the contact through it.
newContactChannel :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactChannelAddress -> ActivationStatus -> ContactChannel

-- | The type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three
--   contact methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS</li>
--   <li>VOICE</li>
--   <li>EMAIL</li>
--   </ul>
contactChannel_type :: Lens' ContactChannel (Maybe ChannelType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
contactChannel_contactChannelArn :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that contains the contact channel.
contactChannel_contactArn :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The name of the contact channel.
contactChannel_name :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
contactChannel_deliveryAddress :: Lens' ContactChannel ContactChannelAddress

-- | A Boolean value describing if the contact channel has been activated
--   or not. If the contact channel isn't activated, Incident Manager can't
--   engage the contact through it.
contactChannel_activationStatus :: Lens' ContactChannel ActivationStatus

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactChannelAddress</a> smart constructor.
data ContactChannelAddress
ContactChannelAddress' :: Maybe Text -> ContactChannelAddress

-- | The format is dependent on the type of the contact channel. The
--   following are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:simpleAddress:ContactChannelAddress'] :: ContactChannelAddress -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactChannelAddress</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleAddress:ContactChannelAddress'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannelAddress_simpleAddress</a> - The format is dependent
--   on the type of the contact channel. The following are the expected
--   formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
newContactChannelAddress :: ContactChannelAddress

-- | The format is dependent on the type of the contact channel. The
--   following are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
contactChannelAddress_simpleAddress :: Lens' ContactChannelAddress (Maybe Text)

-- | The contact that Incident Manager is engaging during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactTargetInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ContactTargetInfo
ContactTargetInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Bool -> ContactTargetInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact.
[$sel:contactId:ContactTargetInfo'] :: ContactTargetInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value determining if the contact's acknowledgement stops the
--   progress of stages in the plan.
[$sel:isEssential:ContactTargetInfo'] :: ContactTargetInfo -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactTargetInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:ContactTargetInfo'</a>,
--   <a>contactTargetInfo_contactId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isEssential:ContactTargetInfo'</a>,
--   <a>contactTargetInfo_isEssential</a> - A Boolean value determining if
--   the contact's acknowledgement stops the progress of stages in the
--   plan.
newContactTargetInfo :: Bool -> ContactTargetInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact.
contactTargetInfo_contactId :: Lens' ContactTargetInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value determining if the contact's acknowledgement stops the
--   progress of stages in the plan.
contactTargetInfo_isEssential :: Lens' ContactTargetInfo Bool

-- | Incident Manager reaching out to a contact or escalation plan to
--   engage contact during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEngagement</a> smart constructor.
data Engagement
Engagement' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Engagement

-- | The time that the engagement began.
[$sel:startTime:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time that the engagement ended.
[$sel:stopTime:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact.
[$sel:incidentId:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
[$sel:engagementArn:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Text

-- | The ARN of the escalation plan or contact that Incident Manager is
--   engaging.
[$sel:contactArn:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
[$sel:sender:Engagement'] :: Engagement -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Engagement</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_startTime</a> - The
--   time that the engagement began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopTime:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_stopTime</a> - The
--   time that the engagement ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_incidentId</a> - The
--   ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_engagementArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_contactArn</a> - The
--   ARN of the escalation plan or contact that Incident Manager is
--   engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_sender</a> - The user
--   that started the engagement.
newEngagement :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Engagement

-- | The time that the engagement began.
engagement_startTime :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time that the engagement ended.
engagement_stopTime :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact.
engagement_incidentId :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
engagement_engagementArn :: Lens' Engagement Text

-- | The ARN of the escalation plan or contact that Incident Manager is
--   engaging.
engagement_contactArn :: Lens' Engagement Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
engagement_sender :: Lens' Engagement Text

-- | Incident Manager engaging a contact's contact channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPage</a> smart constructor.
data Page
Page' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Page

-- | The time that the contact channel acknowledged engagement.
[$sel:readTime:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The time the message was delivered to the contact channel.
[$sel:deliveryTime:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact channel.
[$sel:incidentId:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that Incident Manager engaged the contact channel.
[$sel:sentTime:Page'] :: Page -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the page to the contact channel.
[$sel:pageArn:Page'] :: Page -> Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement that this page is part of.
[$sel:engagementArn:Page'] :: Page -> Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
[$sel:contactArn:Page'] :: Page -> Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
[$sel:sender:Page'] :: Page -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Page</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:readTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_readTime</a> - The time that the
--   contact channel acknowledged engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_deliveryTime</a> - The time
--   the message was delivered to the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:Page'</a>, <a>page_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the
--   incident that's engaging the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_sentTime</a> - The time that
--   Incident Manager engaged the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_pageArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the page to the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_engagementArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the engagement that this page is part of.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:Page'</a>, <a>page_sender</a> - The user that started
--   the engagement.
newPage :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Page

-- | The time that the contact channel acknowledged engagement.
page_readTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time the message was delivered to the contact channel.
page_deliveryTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact channel.
page_incidentId :: Lens' Page (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that Incident Manager engaged the contact channel.
page_sentTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the page to the contact channel.
page_pageArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement that this page is part of.
page_engagementArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
page_contactArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
page_sender :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The stages that an escalation plan or engagement plan engages contacts
--   and contact methods in.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlan</a> smart constructor.
data Plan
Plan' :: [Stage] -> Plan

-- | A list of stages that the escalation plan or engagement plan uses to
--   engage contacts and contact methods.
[$sel:stages:Plan'] :: Plan -> [Stage]

-- | Create a value of <a>Plan</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stages:Plan'</a>, <a>plan_stages</a> - A list of stages that
--   the escalation plan or engagement plan uses to engage contacts and
--   contact methods.
newPlan :: Plan

-- | A list of stages that the escalation plan or engagement plan uses to
--   engage contacts and contact methods.
plan_stages :: Lens' Plan [Stage]

-- | Records events during an engagement.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReceipt</a> smart constructor.
data Receipt
Receipt' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReceiptType -> POSIX -> Receipt

-- | Information provided during the page acknowledgement.
[$sel:receiptInfo:Receipt'] :: Receipt -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel Incident Manager
--   engaged.
[$sel:contactChannelArn:Receipt'] :: Receipt -> Maybe Text

-- | The type follows the engagement cycle, <tt>SENT</tt>,
--   <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, and <tt>READ</tt>.
[$sel:receiptType:Receipt'] :: Receipt -> ReceiptType

-- | The time receipt was <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, or
--   <tt>READ</tt>.
[$sel:receiptTime:Receipt'] :: Receipt -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Receipt</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptInfo:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptInfo</a> -
--   Information provided during the page acknowledgement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelArn:Receipt'</a>,
--   <a>receipt_contactChannelArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the contact channel Incident Manager engaged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptType:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptType</a> - The
--   type follows the engagement cycle, <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>,
--   and <tt>READ</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptTime:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptTime</a> - The
--   time receipt was <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, or <tt>READ</tt>.
newReceipt :: ReceiptType -> UTCTime -> Receipt

-- | Information provided during the page acknowledgement.
receipt_receiptInfo :: Lens' Receipt (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel Incident Manager
--   engaged.
receipt_contactChannelArn :: Lens' Receipt (Maybe Text)

-- | The type follows the engagement cycle, <tt>SENT</tt>,
--   <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, and <tt>READ</tt>.
receipt_receiptType :: Lens' Receipt ReceiptType

-- | The time receipt was <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, or
--   <tt>READ</tt>.
receipt_receiptTime :: Lens' Receipt UTCTime

-- | A set amount of time that an escalation plan or engagement plan
--   engages the specified contacts or contact methods.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStage</a> smart constructor.
data Stage
Stage' :: Natural -> [Target] -> Stage

-- | The time to wait until beginning the next stage. The duration can only
--   be set to 0 if a target is specified.
[$sel:durationInMinutes:Stage'] :: Stage -> Natural

-- | The contacts or contact methods that the escalation plan or engagement
--   plan is engaging.
[$sel:targets:Stage'] :: Stage -> [Target]

-- | Create a value of <a>Stage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInMinutes:Stage'</a>, <a>stage_durationInMinutes</a> -
--   The time to wait until beginning the next stage. The duration can only
--   be set to 0 if a target is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:Stage'</a>, <a>stage_targets</a> - The contacts or
--   contact methods that the escalation plan or engagement plan is
--   engaging.
newStage :: Natural -> Stage

-- | The time to wait until beginning the next stage. The duration can only
--   be set to 0 if a target is specified.
stage_durationInMinutes :: Lens' Stage Natural

-- | The contacts or contact methods that the escalation plan or engagement
--   plan is engaging.
stage_targets :: Lens' Stage [Target]

-- | A container of a key-value name pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | Value of the tag.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Name of the object key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Value of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Name of the object key.
newTag :: Tag

-- | Value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | Name of the object key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The contact or contact channel that's being engaged.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTarget</a> smart constructor.
data Target
Target' :: Maybe ChannelTargetInfo -> Maybe ContactTargetInfo -> Target

-- | Information about the contact channel Incident Manager is engaging.
[$sel:channelTargetInfo:Target'] :: Target -> Maybe ChannelTargetInfo

-- | Information about the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
[$sel:contactTargetInfo:Target'] :: Target -> Maybe ContactTargetInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>Target</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelTargetInfo:Target'</a>, <a>target_channelTargetInfo</a>
--   - Information about the contact channel Incident Manager is engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactTargetInfo:Target'</a>, <a>target_contactTargetInfo</a>
--   - Information about the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
newTarget :: Target

-- | Information about the contact channel Incident Manager is engaging.
target_channelTargetInfo :: Lens' Target (Maybe ChannelTargetInfo)

-- | Information about the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
target_contactTargetInfo :: Lens' Target (Maybe ContactTargetInfo)

-- | A range of between two set times
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data TimeRange
TimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> TimeRange

-- | The start of the time range.
[$sel:startTime:TimeRange'] :: TimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The end of the time range.
[$sel:endTime:TimeRange'] :: TimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeRange</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_startTime</a> - The
--   start of the time range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_endTime</a> - The end of
--   the time range.
newTimeRange :: TimeRange

-- | The start of the time range.
timeRange_startTime :: Lens' TimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The end of the time range.
timeRange_endTime :: Lens' TimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)


-- | Tags a contact or escalation plan. You can tag only contacts and
--   escalation plans in the first region of your replication set.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> [Tag] -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:resourceARN:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | A list of tags that you are adding to the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceARN:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceARN</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - A list of
--   tags that you are adding to the contact or escalation plan.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
tagResource_resourceARN :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A list of tags that you are adding to the contact or escalation plan.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource [Tag]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TagResourceResponse
TagResourceResponse' :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'] :: TagResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResourceResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>tagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newTagResourceResponse :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.TagResource.TagResource


-- | Stops an engagement before it finishes the final stage of the
--   escalation plan or engagement plan. Further contacts aren't engaged.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopEngagement</a> smart constructor.
data StopEngagement
StopEngagement' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> StopEngagement

-- | The reason that you're stopping the engagement.
[$sel:reason:StopEngagement'] :: StopEngagement -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
[$sel:engagementId:StopEngagement'] :: StopEngagement -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StopEngagement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:StopEngagement'</a>, <a>stopEngagement_reason</a> - The
--   reason that you're stopping the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementId:StopEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>stopEngagement_engagementId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the engagement.
newStopEngagement :: Text -> StopEngagement

-- | The reason that you're stopping the engagement.
stopEngagement_reason :: Lens' StopEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
stopEngagement_engagementId :: Lens' StopEngagement Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopEngagementResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StopEngagementResponse
StopEngagementResponse' :: Int -> StopEngagementResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:StopEngagementResponse'] :: StopEngagementResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>StopEngagementResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StopEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>stopEngagementResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newStopEngagementResponse :: Int -> StopEngagementResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
stopEngagementResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StopEngagementResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagementResponse

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StopEngagement.StopEngagement


-- | Starts an engagement to a contact or escalation plan. The engagement
--   engages each contact specified in the incident.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StartEngagement

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartEngagement</a> smart constructor.
data StartEngagement
StartEngagement' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartEngagement

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:StartEngagement'] :: StartEngagement -> Maybe Text

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
[$sel:publicSubject:StartEngagement'] :: StartEngagement -> Maybe Text

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
[$sel:publicContent:StartEngagement'] :: StartEngagement -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the incident that the engagement is part of.
[$sel:incidentId:StartEngagement'] :: StartEngagement -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact being engaged.
[$sel:contactId:StartEngagement'] :: StartEngagement -> Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
[$sel:sender:StartEngagement'] :: StartEngagement -> Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
[$sel:subject:StartEngagement'] :: StartEngagement -> Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
[$sel:content:StartEngagement'] :: StartEngagement -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartEngagement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:StartEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagement_idempotencyToken</a> - A token ensuring that the
--   operation is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicSubject:StartEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagement_publicSubject</a> - The insecure subject of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicContent:StartEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagement_publicContent</a> - The insecure content of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:StartEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagement_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the incident that the
--   engagement is part of.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:StartEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagement_contactId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the contact being engaged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:StartEngagement'</a>, <a>startEngagement_sender</a> -
--   The user that started the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:StartEngagement'</a>, <a>startEngagement_subject</a> -
--   The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:StartEngagement'</a>, <a>startEngagement_content</a> -
--   The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
newStartEngagement :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartEngagement

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
startEngagement_idempotencyToken :: Lens' StartEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
startEngagement_publicSubject :: Lens' StartEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
startEngagement_publicContent :: Lens' StartEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the incident that the engagement is part of.
startEngagement_incidentId :: Lens' StartEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact being engaged.
startEngagement_contactId :: Lens' StartEngagement Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
startEngagement_sender :: Lens' StartEngagement Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
startEngagement_subject :: Lens' StartEngagement Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
startEngagement_content :: Lens' StartEngagement Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartEngagementResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StartEngagementResponse
StartEngagementResponse' :: Int -> Text -> StartEngagementResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:StartEngagementResponse'] :: StartEngagementResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN of the engagement.
[$sel:engagementArn:StartEngagementResponse'] :: StartEngagementResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartEngagementResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StartEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagementResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:StartEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagementResponse_engagementArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   engagement.
newStartEngagementResponse :: Int -> Text -> StartEngagementResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
startEngagementResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartEngagementResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the engagement.
startEngagementResponse_engagementArn :: Lens' StartEngagementResponse Text

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StartEngagement.StartEngagement
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StartEngagement.StartEngagement
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StartEngagement.StartEngagement

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StartEngagement.StartEngagementResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StartEngagement.StartEngagementResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StartEngagement.StartEngagementResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.StartEngagement.StartEngagement


-- | Sends an activation code to a contact channel. The contact can use
--   this code to activate the contact channel in the console or with the
--   <tt>ActivateChannel</tt> operation. Incident Manager can't engage a
--   contact channel until it has been activated.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.SendActivationCode

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSendActivationCode</a> smart constructor.
data SendActivationCode
SendActivationCode' :: Text -> SendActivationCode

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelId:SendActivationCode'] :: SendActivationCode -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SendActivationCode</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:SendActivationCode'</a>,
--   <a>sendActivationCode_contactChannelId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the contact channel.
newSendActivationCode :: Text -> SendActivationCode

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
sendActivationCode_contactChannelId :: Lens' SendActivationCode Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSendActivationCodeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SendActivationCodeResponse
SendActivationCodeResponse' :: Int -> SendActivationCodeResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SendActivationCodeResponse'] :: SendActivationCodeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SendActivationCodeResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SendActivationCodeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendActivationCodeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newSendActivationCodeResponse :: Int -> SendActivationCodeResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
sendActivationCodeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SendActivationCodeResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.SendActivationCode.SendActivationCode
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.SendActivationCode.SendActivationCode
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.SendActivationCode.SendActivationCode
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.SendActivationCode.SendActivationCode
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.SendActivationCode.SendActivationCodeResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.SendActivationCode.SendActivationCode

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.SendActivationCode.SendActivationCode

-- | Adds a resource to the specified contact or escalation plan.

--   the contact or escalation plan.

--   Details of the resource policy.

-- | Lists the tags of an escalation plan or contact.

-- | Lists the engagements to contact channels that occurred by engaging a
--   contact.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListPagesByEngagement

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPagesByEngagement</a> smart constructor.
data ListPagesByEngagement
ListPagesByEngagement' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListPagesByEngagement

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPagesByEngagement'] :: ListPagesByEngagement -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of engagements to contact channels to list per page
--   of results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListPagesByEngagement'] :: ListPagesByEngagement -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
[$sel:engagementId:ListPagesByEngagement'] :: ListPagesByEngagement -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPagesByEngagement</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPagesByEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>listPagesByEngagement_nextToken</a> - The pagination token to
--   continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListPagesByEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>listPagesByEngagement_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   engagements to contact channels to list per page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementId:ListPagesByEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>listPagesByEngagement_engagementId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the engagement.
newListPagesByEngagement :: Text -> ListPagesByEngagement

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPagesByEngagement_nextToken :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of engagements to contact channels to list per page
--   of results.
listPagesByEngagement_maxResults :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagement (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
listPagesByEngagement_engagementId :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagement Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPagesByEngagementResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListPagesByEngagementResponse
ListPagesByEngagementResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [Page] -> ListPagesByEngagementResponse

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPagesByEngagementResponse'] :: ListPagesByEngagementResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListPagesByEngagementResponse'] :: ListPagesByEngagementResponse -> Int

-- | The list of engagements to contact channels.
[$sel:pages:ListPagesByEngagementResponse'] :: ListPagesByEngagementResponse -> [Page]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPagesByEngagementResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPagesByEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>listPagesByEngagementResponse_nextToken</a> - The pagination token
--   to continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListPagesByEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPagesByEngagementResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pages:ListPagesByEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPagesByEngagementResponse_pages</a> - The list of engagements
--   to contact channels.
newListPagesByEngagementResponse :: Int -> ListPagesByEngagementResponse

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPagesByEngagementResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagementResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listPagesByEngagementResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagementResponse Int

-- | The list of engagements to contact channels.
listPagesByEngagementResponse_pages :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagementResponse [Page]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListPagesByEngagement.ListPagesByEngagement
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListPagesByEngagement.ListPagesByEngagement
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListPagesByEngagement.ListPagesByEngagement
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListPagesByEngagement.ListPagesByEngagement
