-- | Lists the engagements to a contact's contact channels.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListPagesByContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPagesByContact</a> smart constructor.
data ListPagesByContact
ListPagesByContact' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListPagesByContact

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPagesByContact'] :: ListPagesByContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of engagements to contact channels to list per page
--   of results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListPagesByContact'] :: ListPagesByContact -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact you are retrieving
--   engagements for.

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPagesByContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   engagements to contact channels to list per page of results.

--   of results.

--   engagements for.
listPagesByContact_contactId :: Lens' ListPagesByContact Text

-- | Lists all of the engagements to contact channels that have been
--   acknowledged.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListPageReceipts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPageReceipts</a> smart constructor.
data ListPageReceipts
ListPageReceipts' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListPageReceipts

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPageReceipts'] :: ListPageReceipts -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of acknowledgements per page of results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListPageReceipts'] :: ListPageReceipts -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a specific contact
--   channel.
[$sel:pageId:ListPageReceipts'] :: ListPageReceipts -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPageReceipts</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPageReceipts'</a>,
--   <a>listPageReceipts_nextToken</a> - The pagination token to continue
--   to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListPageReceipts'</a>,
--   <a>listPageReceipts_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   acknowledgements per page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageId:ListPageReceipts'</a>, <a>listPageReceipts_pageId</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a specific contact
--   channel.

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPageReceipts_nextToken :: Lens' ListPageReceipts (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of acknowledgements per page of results.
listPageReceipts_maxResults :: Lens' ListPageReceipts (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a specific contact
--   channel.
listPageReceipts_pageId :: Lens' ListPageReceipts Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPageReceiptsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListPageReceiptsResponse
ListPageReceiptsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Receipt] -> Int -> ListPageReceiptsResponse

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPageReceiptsResponse'] :: ListPageReceiptsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of each acknowledgement.
[$sel:receipts:ListPageReceiptsResponse'] :: ListPageReceiptsResponse -> Maybe [Receipt]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListPageReceiptsResponse'] :: ListPageReceiptsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPageReceiptsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:receipts:ListPageReceiptsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPageReceiptsResponse_receipts</a> - A list of each
--   acknowledgement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListPageReceiptsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPageReceiptsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newListPageReceiptsResponse :: Int -> ListPageReceiptsResponse

-- | Lists all engagements that have happened in an incident.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListEngagements

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListEngagements</a> smart constructor.
data ListEngagements
ListEngagements' :: Maybe TimeRange -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListEngagements

-- | The time range to lists engagements for an incident.
[$sel:timeRangeValue:ListEngagements'] :: ListEngagements -> Maybe TimeRange

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListEngagements'] :: ListEngagements -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident you're listing
--   engagements for.
[$sel:incidentId:ListEngagements'] :: ListEngagements -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of engagements per page of results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListEngagements'] :: ListEngagements -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListEngagements</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   engagements for an incident.
--

--   <a>listEngagements_nextToken</a> - The pagination token to continue to
--   the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:ListEngagements'</a>,
--   <a>listEngagements_incidentId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the incident you're listing engagements for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListEngagements'</a>,
--   <a>listEngagements_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of engagements
--   per page of results.

-- | The time range to lists engagements for an incident.
listEngagements_timeRangeValue :: Lens' ListEngagements (Maybe TimeRange)

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listEngagements_nextToken :: Lens' ListEngagements (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident you're listing
--   engagements for.
listEngagements_incidentId :: Lens' ListEngagements (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of engagements per page of results.
listEngagements_maxResults :: Lens' ListEngagements (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListEngagementsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListEngagementsResponse
ListEngagementsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [Engagement] -> ListEngagementsResponse

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListEngagementsResponse'] :: ListEngagementsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListEngagementsResponse'] :: ListEngagementsResponse -> Int

--   range of an incident.

--   fields omitted.

--   continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListEngagementsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listEngagementsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagements:ListEngagementsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listEngagementsResponse_engagements</a> - A list of each engagement
--   that occurred during the specified time range of an incident.

-- | Lists all contacts and escalation plans in Incident Manager.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListContacts</a> smart constructor.
data ListContacts
ListContacts' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContactType -> Maybe Natural -> ListContacts

-- | Used to list only contacts who's aliases start with the specified
--   prefix.
[$sel:aliasPrefix:ListContacts'] :: ListContacts -> Maybe Text

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListContacts'] :: ListContacts -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of contact. A contact is type <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an
--   escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
[$sel:type':ListContacts'] :: ListContacts -> Maybe ContactType

-- | The maximum number of contacts and escalation plans per page of
--   results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListContacts'] :: ListContacts -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListContacts</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aliasPrefix:ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_aliasPrefix</a>
--   - Used to list only contacts who's aliases start with the specified
--   prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_nextToken</a> -
--   The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_type</a> - The type
--   of contact. A contact is type <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an escalation plan
--   is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_maxResults</a> -
--   The maximum number of contacts and escalation plans per page of
--   results.
newListContacts :: ListContacts

-- | Used to list only contacts who's aliases start with the specified
--   prefix.
listContacts_aliasPrefix :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe Text)

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listContacts_nextToken :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of contact. A contact is type <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an
--   escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
listContacts_type :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe ContactType)

-- | The maximum number of contacts and escalation plans per page of
--   results.
listContacts_maxResults :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListContactsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListContactsResponse
ListContactsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Contact] -> Int -> ListContactsResponse

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListContactsResponse'] :: ListContactsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the contacts and escalation plans in your Incident Manager
--   account.
[$sel:contacts:ListContactsResponse'] :: ListContactsResponse -> Maybe [Contact]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListContactsResponse'] :: ListContactsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListContactsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListContacts'</a>,
--   <a>listContactsResponse_nextToken</a> - The pagination token to
--   continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contacts:ListContactsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listContactsResponse_contacts</a> - A list of the contacts and
--   escalation plans in your Incident Manager account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListContactsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listContactsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListContactsResponse :: Int -> ListContactsResponse

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listContactsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListContactsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the contacts and escalation plans in your Incident Manager
--   account.
listContactsResponse_contacts :: Lens' ListContactsResponse (Maybe [Contact])

-- | The response's http status code.
listContactsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListContactsResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContactsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContactsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContactsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContactsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContactsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Pager.AWSPager Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContacts.ListContacts


-- | Lists all contact channels for the specified contact.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ListContactChannels

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListContactChannels</a> smart constructor.
data ListContactChannels
ListContactChannels' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListContactChannels

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListContactChannels'] :: ListContactChannels -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of contact channels per page.
[$sel:maxResults:ListContactChannels'] :: ListContactChannels -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact.
[$sel:contactId:ListContactChannels'] :: ListContactChannels -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListContactChannels</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   channels per page.

--   <a>listContactChannels_contactId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the contact.

--   fields omitted.

-- | List details about a specific contact channel.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.GetContactChannel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data GetContactChannel
GetContactChannel' :: Text -> GetContactChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you want
--   information about.
[$sel:contactChannelId:GetContactChannel'] :: GetContactChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetContactChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:GetContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>getContactChannel_contactChannelId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the contact channel you want information about.
newGetContactChannel :: Text -> GetContactChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you want
--   information about.
getContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' GetContactChannel Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetContactChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetContactChannelResponse
GetContactChannelResponse' :: Maybe ActivationStatus -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ChannelType -> ContactChannelAddress -> GetContactChannelResponse

-- | A Boolean value indicating if the contact channel has been activated
--   or not.
[$sel:activationStatus:GetContactChannelResponse'] :: GetContactChannelResponse -> Maybe ActivationStatus

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetContactChannelResponse'] :: GetContactChannelResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN of the contact that the channel belongs to.
[$sel:contactArn:GetContactChannelResponse'] :: GetContactChannelResponse -> Text

-- | The ARN of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelArn:GetContactChannelResponse'] :: GetContactChannelResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the contact channel
[$sel:name:GetContactChannelResponse'] :: GetContactChannelResponse -> Text

-- | The type of contact channel. The type is <tt>SMS</tt>, <tt>VOICE</tt>,
--   or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
[$sel:type':GetContactChannelResponse'] :: GetContactChannelResponse -> ChannelType

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
[$sel:deliveryAddress:GetContactChannelResponse'] :: GetContactChannelResponse -> ContactChannelAddress

-- | Create a value of <a>GetContactChannelResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:activationStatus:GetContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactChannelResponse_activationStatus</a> - A Boolean value
--   indicating if the contact channel has been activated or not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactChannelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:GetContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactChannelResponse_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the contact
--   that the channel belongs to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelArn:GetContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactChannelResponse_contactChannelArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:GetContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactChannelResponse_name</a> - The name of the contact
--   channel
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':GetContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactChannelResponse_type</a> - The type of contact channel.
--   The type is <tt>SMS</tt>, <tt>VOICE</tt>, or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryAddress:GetContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactChannelResponse_deliveryAddress</a> - The details that
--   Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the contact channel.
newGetContactChannelResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ChannelType -> ContactChannelAddress -> GetContactChannelResponse

--   or not.

-- | The ARN of the contact channel.
getContactChannelResponse_contactChannelArn :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse Text

-- | The name of the contact channel
getContactChannelResponse_name :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse Text

-- | The type of contact channel. The type is <tt>SMS</tt>, <tt>VOICE</tt>,
--   or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
getContactChannelResponse_type :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse ChannelType

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
getContactChannelResponse_deliveryAddress :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse ContactChannelAddress

-- | Retrieves information about the specified contact or escalation plan.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.GetContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetContact</a> smart constructor.
data GetContact
GetContact' :: Text -> GetContact

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:contactId:GetContact'] :: GetContact -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetContact</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:GetContact'</a>, <a>getContact_contactId</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
newGetContact :: Text -> GetContact

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
getContact_contactId :: Lens' GetContact Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetContactResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetContactResponse
GetContactResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> ContactType -> Plan -> GetContactResponse

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:displayName:GetContactResponse'] :: GetContactResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetContactResponse'] :: GetContactResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:contactArn:GetContactResponse'] :: GetContactResponse -> Text

-- | The alias of the contact or escalation plan. The alias is unique and
--   identifiable.
[$sel:alias:GetContactResponse'] :: GetContactResponse -> Text

-- | The type of contact, either <tt>PERSONAL</tt> or <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
[$sel:type':GetContactResponse'] :: GetContactResponse -> ContactType

-- | Details about the specific timing or stages and targets of the
--   escalation plan or engagement plan.
[$sel:plan:GetContactResponse'] :: GetContactResponse -> Plan

-- | Create a value of <a>GetContactResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:GetContactResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactResponse_displayName</a> - The full name of the contact
--   or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetContactResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:GetContactResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContactResponse_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the contact or
--   escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:GetContactResponse'</a>, <a>getContactResponse_alias</a>
--   - The alias of the contact or escalation plan. The alias is unique and
--   identifiable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':GetContactResponse'</a>, <a>getContactResponse_type</a>
--   - The type of contact, either <tt>PERSONAL</tt> or
--   <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plan:GetContactResponse'</a>, <a>getContactResponse_plan</a> -
--   Details about the specific timing or stages and targets of the
--   escalation plan or engagement plan.
newGetContactResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> ContactType -> Plan -> GetContactResponse

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
getContactResponse_displayName :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetContactResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the contact or escalation plan.
getContactResponse_contactArn :: Lens' GetContactResponse Text

-- | The alias of the contact or escalation plan. The alias is unique and
--   identifiable.
getContactResponse_alias :: Lens' GetContactResponse Text

-- | The type of contact, either <tt>PERSONAL</tt> or <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
getContactResponse_type :: Lens' GetContactResponse ContactType

-- | Details about the specific timing or stages and targets of the
--   escalation plan or engagement plan.
getContactResponse_plan :: Lens' GetContactResponse Plan

-- | Lists details of the engagement to a contact channel.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribePage</a> smart constructor.
data DescribePage
DescribePage' :: Text -> DescribePage

-- | The ID of the engagement to a contact channel.
[$sel:pageId:DescribePage'] :: DescribePage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageId:DescribePage'</a>, <a>describePage_pageId</a> - The ID
--   of the engagement to a contact channel.
newDescribePage :: Text -> DescribePage

-- | The ID of the engagement to a contact channel.
describePage_pageId :: Lens' DescribePage Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribePageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribePageResponse
DescribePageResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribePageResponse

-- | The time that the contact channel acknowledged the engagement.
[$sel:readTime:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
[$sel:publicSubject:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
[$sel:publicContent:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the contact channel received the engagement.
[$sel:deliveryTime:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the incident that engaged the contact channel.
[$sel:incidentId:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The time the engagement was sent to the contact channel.
[$sel:sentTime:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a contact channel.
[$sel:pageArn:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement that engaged the contact channel.
[$sel:engagementArn:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that was engaged.
[$sel:contactArn:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
[$sel:sender:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
[$sel:subject:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
[$sel:content:DescribePageResponse'] :: DescribePageResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePageResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:readTime:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_readTime</a> - The time that the contact
--   channel acknowledged the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicSubject:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_publicSubject</a> - The insecure subject of
--   the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for
--   engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicContent:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_publicContent</a> - The insecure content of
--   the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for
--   engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryTime:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_deliveryTime</a> - The time that the contact
--   channel received the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the incident that
--   engaged the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentTime:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_sentTime</a> - The time the engagement was
--   sent to the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageArn:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_pageArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the engagement to a contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_engagementArn</a> - The ARN of the engagement
--   that engaged the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the contact that
--   was engaged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_sender</a> - The user that started the
--   engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_subject</a> - The secure subject of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_content</a> - The secure content of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
newDescribePageResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribePageResponse

-- | The time that the contact channel acknowledged the engagement.
describePageResponse_readTime :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
describePageResponse_publicSubject :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
describePageResponse_publicContent :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the contact channel received the engagement.
describePageResponse_deliveryTime :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident that engaged the contact channel.
describePageResponse_incidentId :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the engagement was sent to the contact channel.
describePageResponse_sentTime :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The response's http status code.
describePageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a contact channel.
describePageResponse_pageArn :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement that engaged the contact channel.
describePageResponse_engagementArn :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that was engaged.
describePageResponse_contactArn :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
describePageResponse_sender :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
describePageResponse_subject :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
describePageResponse_content :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePageResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePageResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePageResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePageResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePageResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribePage.DescribePage


-- | Incident Manager uses engagements to engage contacts and escalation
--   plans during an incident. Use this command to describe the engagement
--   that occurred during an incident.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DescribeEngagement

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEngagement</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEngagement
DescribeEngagement' :: Text -> DescribeEngagement

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement you want the details
--   of.
[$sel:engagementId:DescribeEngagement'] :: DescribeEngagement -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEngagement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementId:DescribeEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagement_engagementId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the engagement you want the details of.
newDescribeEngagement :: Text -> DescribeEngagement

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement you want the details
--   of.
describeEngagement_engagementId :: Lens' DescribeEngagement Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEngagementResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEngagementResponse
DescribeEngagementResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeEngagementResponse

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
[$sel:publicSubject:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the engagement started.
[$sel:startTime:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
[$sel:publicContent:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the engagement ended.
[$sel:stopTime:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ARN of the incident in which the engagement occurred.
[$sel:incidentId:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN of the escalation plan or contacts involved in the engagement.
[$sel:contactArn:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement.
[$sel:engagementArn:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
[$sel:sender:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
[$sel:subject:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
[$sel:content:DescribeEngagementResponse'] :: DescribeEngagementResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEngagementResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicSubject:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_publicSubject</a> - The insecure subject
--   of the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for
--   engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_startTime</a> - The time that the
--   engagement started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicContent:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_publicContent</a> - The insecure content
--   of the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for
--   engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopTime:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_stopTime</a> - The time that the
--   engagement ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the incident
--   in which the engagement occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   escalation plan or contacts involved in the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_engagementArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_sender</a> - The user that started the
--   engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_subject</a> - The secure subject of the

--   to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.

--   <a>$sel:content:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_content</a> - The secure content of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
newDescribeEngagementResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeEngagementResponse

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
describeEngagementResponse_publicSubject :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the engagement started.
describeEngagementResponse_startTime :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
describeEngagementResponse_publicContent :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the engagement ended.
describeEngagementResponse_stopTime :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident in which the engagement occurred.
describeEngagementResponse_incidentId :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeEngagementResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the escalation plan or contacts involved in the engagement.
describeEngagementResponse_contactArn :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement.
describeEngagementResponse_engagementArn :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
describeEngagementResponse_sender :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
describeEngagementResponse_subject :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
describeEngagementResponse_content :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | To no longer receive engagements on a contact channel, you can delete
--   the channel from a contact. Deleting the contact channel removes it
--   from the contact's engagement plan. If you delete the only contact
--   channel for a contact, you won't be able to engage that contact during
--   an incident.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DeleteContactChannel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteContactChannel
DeleteContactChannel' :: Text -> DeleteContactChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelId:DeleteContactChannel'] :: DeleteContactChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteContactChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:DeleteContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>deleteContactChannel_contactChannelId</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
newDeleteContactChannel :: Text -> DeleteContactChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
deleteContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' DeleteContactChannel Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteContactChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteContactChannelResponse
DeleteContactChannelResponse' :: Int -> DeleteContactChannelResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteContactChannelResponse'] :: DeleteContactChannelResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteContactChannelResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>deleteContactChannelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

deleteContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteContactChannelResponse Int

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DeleteContactChannel.DeleteContactChannel
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DeleteContactChannel.DeleteContactChannel


-- | To remove a contact from Incident Manager, you can delete the contact.
--   Deleting a contact removes them from all escalation plans and related
--   response plans. Deleting an escalation plan removes it from all
--   related response plans. You will have to recreate the contact and its
--   contact channels before you can use it again.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DeleteContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteContact</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteContact
DeleteContact' :: Text -> DeleteContact

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact that you're deleting.
[$sel:contactId:DeleteContact'] :: DeleteContact -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:DeleteContact'</a>, <a>deleteContact_contactId</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact that you're deleting.
newDeleteContact :: Text -> DeleteContact

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact that you're deleting.
deleteContact_contactId :: Lens' DeleteContact Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteContactResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteContactResponse
DeleteContactResponse' :: Int -> DeleteContactResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteContactResponse'] :: DeleteContactResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteContactResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteContactResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteContactResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDeleteContactResponse :: Int -> DeleteContactResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteContactResponse Int

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DeleteContact.DeleteContact
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DeleteContact.DeleteContact

-- | To no longer receive Incident Manager engagements to a contact
--   channel, you can deactivate the channel.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DeactivateContactChannel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeactivateContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data DeactivateContactChannel
DeactivateContactChannel' :: Text -> DeactivateContactChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you're
--   deactivating.
[$sel:contactChannelId:DeactivateContactChannel'] :: DeactivateContactChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeactivateContactChannel</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:DeactivateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>deactivateContactChannel_contactChannelId</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the contact channel you're deactivating.
newDeactivateContactChannel :: Text -> DeactivateContactChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you're
--   deactivating.
deactivateContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' DeactivateContactChannel Text

--   constructor.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>deactivateContactChannelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.DeactivateContactChannel.DeactivateContactChannel


-- | A contact channel is the method that Incident Manager uses to engage
--   your contact.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContactChannel
CreateContactChannel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> ChannelType -> ContactChannelAddress -> CreateContactChannel

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateContactChannel'] :: CreateContactChannel -> Maybe Text

-- | If you want to activate the channel at a later time, you can choose to
--   defer activation. Incident Manager can't engage your contact channel
--   until it has been activated.
[$sel:deferActivation:CreateContactChannel'] :: CreateContactChannel -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact you are adding the
--   contact channel to.
[$sel:contactId:CreateContactChannel'] :: CreateContactChannel -> Text

-- | The name of the contact channel.
[$sel:name:CreateContactChannel'] :: CreateContactChannel -> Text

-- | Incident Manager supports three types of contact channels:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>SMS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>VOICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>EMAIL</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':CreateContactChannel'] :: CreateContactChannel -> ChannelType

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel. The format is dependent on the type of the contact
--   channel. The following are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:deliveryAddress:CreateContactChannel'] :: CreateContactChannel -> ContactChannelAddress

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContactChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_idempotencyToken</a> - A token ensuring that
--   the operation is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deferActivation:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_deferActivation</a> - If you want to activate
--   the channel at a later time, you can choose to defer activation.
--   Incident Manager can't engage your contact channel until it has been
--   activated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_contactId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the contact you are adding the contact channel to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_name</a> - The name of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_type</a> - Incident Manager supports three
--   types of contact channels:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>SMS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>VOICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>EMAIL</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryAddress:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_deliveryAddress</a> - The details that
--   Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the contact channel. The
--   format is dependent on the type of the contact channel. The following
--   are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
newCreateContactChannel :: Text -> Text -> ChannelType -> ContactChannelAddress -> CreateContactChannel

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
createContactChannel_idempotencyToken :: Lens' CreateContactChannel (Maybe Text)

-- | If you want to activate the channel at a later time, you can choose to
--   defer activation. Incident Manager can't engage your contact channel
--   until it has been activated.
createContactChannel_deferActivation :: Lens' CreateContactChannel (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact you are adding the
--   contact channel to.
createContactChannel_contactId :: Lens' CreateContactChannel Text

-- | The name of the contact channel.
createContactChannel_name :: Lens' CreateContactChannel Text

-- | Incident Manager supports three types of contact channels:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>SMS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>VOICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>EMAIL</pre></li>
--   </ul>
createContactChannel_type :: Lens' CreateContactChannel ChannelType

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel. The format is dependent on the type of the contact
--   channel. The following are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
createContactChannel_deliveryAddress :: Lens' CreateContactChannel ContactChannelAddress

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContactChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContactChannelResponse
CreateContactChannelResponse' :: Int -> Text -> CreateContactChannelResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateContactChannelResponse'] :: CreateContactChannelResponse -> Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelArn:CreateContactChannelResponse'] :: CreateContactChannelResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContactChannelResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelArn:CreateContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannelResponse_contactChannelArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
newCreateContactChannelResponse :: Int -> Text -> CreateContactChannelResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
createContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateContactChannelResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
createContactChannelResponse_contactChannelArn :: Lens' CreateContactChannelResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannelResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannelResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannelResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannelResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannelResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContactChannel.CreateContactChannel


-- | Contacts are either the contacts that Incident Manager engages during
--   an incident or the escalation plans that Incident Manager uses to
--   engage contacts in phases during an incident.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContact</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContact
CreateContact' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> ContactType -> Plan -> CreateContact

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:displayName:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | Adds a tag to the target. You can only tag resources created in the
--   first Region of your replication set.
[$sel:tags:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The short name to quickly identify a contact or escalation plan. The
--   contact alias must be unique and identifiable.
[$sel:alias:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Text

-- | To create an escalation plan use <tt>ESCALATION</tt>. To create a
--   contact use <tt>PERSONAL</tt>.
[$sel:type':CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> ContactType

-- | A list of stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages that
--   contact specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses stages
--   that contact specified contacts.
[$sel:plan:CreateContact'] :: CreateContact -> Plan

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateContact'</a>,
--   <a>createContact_idempotencyToken</a> - A token ensuring that the
--   operation is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:CreateContact'</a>,
--   <a>createContact_displayName</a> - The full name of the contact or
--   escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateContact'</a>, <a>createContact_tags</a> - Adds a
--   tag to the target. You can only tag resources created in the first
--   Region of your replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:CreateContact'</a>, <a>createContact_alias</a> - The
--   short name to quickly identify a contact or escalation plan. The
--   contact alias must be unique and identifiable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreateContact'</a>, <a>createContact_type</a> - To
--   create an escalation plan use <tt>ESCALATION</tt>. To create a contact
--   use <tt>PERSONAL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plan:CreateContact'</a>, <a>createContact_plan</a> - A list of
--   stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages that contact
--   specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses stages that
--   contact specified contacts.
newCreateContact :: Text -> ContactType -> Plan -> CreateContact

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
createContact_idempotencyToken :: Lens' CreateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
createContact_displayName :: Lens' CreateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | Adds a tag to the target. You can only tag resources created in the
--   first Region of your replication set.
createContact_tags :: Lens' CreateContact (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The short name to quickly identify a contact or escalation plan. The
--   contact alias must be unique and identifiable.
createContact_alias :: Lens' CreateContact Text

-- | To create an escalation plan use <tt>ESCALATION</tt>. To create a
--   contact use <tt>PERSONAL</tt>.
createContact_type :: Lens' CreateContact ContactType

-- | A list of stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages that
--   contact specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses stages
--   that contact specified contacts.
createContact_plan :: Lens' CreateContact Plan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContactResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContactResponse
CreateContactResponse' :: Int -> Text -> CreateContactResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateContactResponse'] :: CreateContactResponse -> Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created contact or escalation
--   plan.
[$sel:contactArn:CreateContactResponse'] :: CreateContactResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContactResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateContactResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createContactResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:CreateContactResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createContactResponse_contactArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the created contact or escalation plan.
newCreateContactResponse :: Int -> Text -> CreateContactResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
createContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateContactResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created contact or escalation
--   plan.
createContactResponse_contactArn :: Lens' CreateContactResponse Text

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContact.CreateContact
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContact.CreateContact
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.CreateContact.CreateContact

-- | Activates a contact's contact channel. Incident Manager can't engage a
--   contact until the contact channel has been activated.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ActivateContactChannel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newActivateContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data ActivateContactChannel
ActivateContactChannel' :: Text -> Text -> ActivateContactChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelId:ActivateContactChannel'] :: ActivateContactChannel -> Text

-- | The code sent to the contact channel when it was created in the
--   contact.
[$sel:activationCode:ActivateContactChannel'] :: ActivateContactChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivateContactChannel</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:ActivateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>activateContactChannel_contactChannelId</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activationCode:ActivateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>activateContactChannel_activationCode</a> - The code sent to the
--   contact channel when it was created in the contact.
newActivateContactChannel :: Text -> Text -> ActivateContactChannel

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
activateContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' ActivateContactChannel Text

-- | The code sent to the contact channel when it was created in the
--   contact.
activateContactChannel_activationCode :: Lens' ActivateContactChannel Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newActivateContactChannelResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ActivateContactChannelResponse
ActivateContactChannelResponse' :: Int -> ActivateContactChannelResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ActivateContactChannelResponse'] :: ActivateContactChannelResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivateContactChannelResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ActivateContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>activateContactChannelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newActivateContactChannelResponse :: Int -> ActivateContactChannelResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
activateContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ActivateContactChannelResponse Int

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.ActivateContactChannel.ActivateContactChannel


-- | Used to acknowledge an engagement to a contact channel during an
--   incident.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceptPage</a> smart constructor.
data AcceptPage
AcceptPage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AcceptCodeValidation -> Text -> AcceptType -> Text -> AcceptPage

-- | Information provided by the user when the user acknowledges the page.
[$sel:note:AcceptPage'] :: AcceptPage -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the contact channel.
[$sel:contactChannelId:AcceptPage'] :: AcceptPage -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional field that Incident Manager uses to <tt>ENFORCE</tt>
--   <tt>AcceptCode</tt> validation when acknowledging an page.
--   Acknowledgement can occur by replying to a page, or when entering the
--   AcceptCode in the console. Enforcing AcceptCode validation causes
--   Incident Manager to verify that the code entered by the user matches
--   the code sent by Incident Manager with the page.
--   
--   Incident Manager can also <tt>IGNORE</tt> <tt>AcceptCode</tt>
--   validation. Ignoring <tt>AcceptCode</tt> validation causes Incident
--   Manager to accept any value entered for the <tt>AcceptCode</tt>.
[$sel:acceptCodeValidation:AcceptPage'] :: AcceptPage -> Maybe AcceptCodeValidation

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a contact channel.
[$sel:pageId:AcceptPage'] :: AcceptPage -> Text

-- | The type indicates if the page was <tt>DELIVERED</tt> or
--   <tt>READ</tt>.
[$sel:acceptType:AcceptPage'] :: AcceptPage -> AcceptType

-- | The accept code is a 6-digit code used to acknowledge the page.
[$sel:acceptCode:AcceptPage'] :: AcceptPage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceptPage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:note:AcceptPage'</a>, <a>acceptPage_note</a> - Information
--   provided by the user when the user acknowledges the page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:AcceptPage'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPage_contactChannelId</a> - The ARN of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptCodeValidation:AcceptPage'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPage_acceptCodeValidation</a> - An optional field that
--   Incident Manager uses to <tt>ENFORCE</tt> <tt>AcceptCode</tt>
--   validation when acknowledging an page. Acknowledgement can occur by
--   replying to a page, or when entering the AcceptCode in the console.
--   Enforcing AcceptCode validation causes Incident Manager to verify that
--   the code entered by the user matches the code sent by Incident Manager
--   with the page.
--   
--   Incident Manager can also <tt>IGNORE</tt> <tt>AcceptCode</tt>
--   validation. Ignoring <tt>AcceptCode</tt> validation causes Incident
--   Manager to accept any value entered for the <tt>AcceptCode</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageId:AcceptPage'</a>, <a>acceptPage_pageId</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptType:AcceptPage'</a>, <a>acceptPage_acceptType</a> - The
--   type indicates if the page was <tt>DELIVERED</tt> or <tt>READ</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptCode:AcceptPage'</a>, <a>acceptPage_acceptCode</a> - The
--   accept code is a 6-digit code used to acknowledge the page.
newAcceptPage :: Text -> AcceptType -> Text -> AcceptPage

-- | Information provided by the user when the user acknowledges the page.
acceptPage_note :: Lens' AcceptPage (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the contact channel.
acceptPage_contactChannelId :: Lens' AcceptPage (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional field that Incident Manager uses to <tt>ENFORCE</tt>
--   <tt>AcceptCode</tt> validation when acknowledging an page.
--   Acknowledgement can occur by replying to a page, or when entering the
--   AcceptCode in the console. Enforcing AcceptCode validation causes
--   Incident Manager to verify that the code entered by the user matches
--   the code sent by Incident Manager with the page.
--   
--   Incident Manager can also <tt>IGNORE</tt> <tt>AcceptCode</tt>
--   validation. Ignoring <tt>AcceptCode</tt> validation causes Incident
--   Manager to accept any value entered for the <tt>AcceptCode</tt>.
acceptPage_acceptCodeValidation :: Lens' AcceptPage (Maybe AcceptCodeValidation)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a contact channel.
acceptPage_pageId :: Lens' AcceptPage Text

-- | The type indicates if the page was <tt>DELIVERED</tt> or
--   <tt>READ</tt>.
acceptPage_acceptType :: Lens' AcceptPage AcceptType

-- | The accept code is a 6-digit code used to acknowledge the page.
acceptPage_acceptCode :: Lens' AcceptPage Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceptPageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AcceptPageResponse
AcceptPageResponse' :: Int -> AcceptPageResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AcceptPageResponse'] :: AcceptPageResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceptPageResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AcceptPageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newAcceptPageResponse :: Int -> AcceptPageResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
acceptPageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AcceptPageResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPageResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPageResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPageResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPageResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPageResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.AcceptPage.AcceptPage


-- | Removes tags from the specified resource.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:resourceARN:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The key of the tag that you want to remove.
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceARN:UntagResource'</a>,
--   <a>untagResource_resourceARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   key of the tag that you want to remove.
newUntagResource :: Text -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
untagResource_resourceARN :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The key of the tag that you want to remove.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResourceResponse
UntagResourceResponse' :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UntagResourceResponse'] :: UntagResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResourceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UntagResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>untagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUntagResourceResponse :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
untagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UntagResourceResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UntagResource.UntagResource

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UntagResource.UntagResource


-- | Updates the contact or escalation plan specified.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContact</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContact
UpdateContact' :: Maybe Plan -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateContact

-- | A list of stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages for
--   specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses these stages to
--   contact specified contacts.
[$sel:plan:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Maybe Plan

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
[$sel:displayName:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan
--   you're updating.
[$sel:contactId:UpdateContact'] :: UpdateContact -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:plan:UpdateContact'</a>, <a>updateContact_plan</a> - A list of
--   stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages for specified
--   contact channels. An escalation plan uses these stages to contact
--   specified contacts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:UpdateContact'</a>,
--   <a>updateContact_displayName</a> - The full name of the contact or
--   escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:UpdateContact'</a>, <a>updateContact_contactId</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan
--   you're updating.
newUpdateContact :: Text -> UpdateContact

-- | A list of stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages for
--   specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses these stages to
--   contact specified contacts.
updateContact_plan :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe Plan)

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
updateContact_displayName :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan
--   you're updating.
updateContact_contactId :: Lens' UpdateContact Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContactResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContactResponse
UpdateContactResponse' :: Int -> UpdateContactResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateContactResponse'] :: UpdateContactResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContactResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateContactResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateContactResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateContactResponse :: Int -> UpdateContactResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateContactResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContact
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContact
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContact
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContact

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContactResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContact
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContact
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContact
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContact.UpdateContact


-- | Updates a contact's contact channel.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContactChannel
UpdateContactChannel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ContactChannelAddress -> Text -> UpdateContactChannel

-- | The name of the contact channel.
[$sel:name:UpdateContactChannel'] :: UpdateContactChannel -> Maybe Text

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
[$sel:deliveryAddress:UpdateContactChannel'] :: UpdateContactChannel -> Maybe ContactChannelAddress

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you want to
--   update.
[$sel:contactChannelId:UpdateContactChannel'] :: UpdateContactChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContactChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>updateContactChannel_name</a> - The name of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryAddress:UpdateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>updateContactChannel_deliveryAddress</a> - The details that
--   Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:UpdateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>updateContactChannel_contactChannelId</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the contact channel you want to update.
newUpdateContactChannel :: Text -> UpdateContactChannel

-- | The name of the contact channel.
updateContactChannel_name :: Lens' UpdateContactChannel (Maybe Text)

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
updateContactChannel_deliveryAddress :: Lens' UpdateContactChannel (Maybe ContactChannelAddress)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you want to
--   update.
updateContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' UpdateContactChannel Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContactChannelResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContactChannelResponse
UpdateContactChannelResponse' :: Int -> UpdateContactChannelResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateContactChannelResponse'] :: UpdateContactChannelResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContactChannelResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateContactChannelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateContactChannelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newUpdateContactChannelResponse :: Int -> UpdateContactChannelResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateContactChannelResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannel
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannelResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannelResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannelResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannelResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SSMContacts.UpdateContactChannel.UpdateContactChannel
