module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Lens

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPagesByEngagement_nextToken :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of engagements to contact channels to list per page
--   of results.
listPagesByEngagement_maxResults :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagement (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
listPagesByEngagement_engagementId :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagement Text

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPagesByEngagementResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagementResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listPagesByEngagementResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagementResponse Int

-- | The list of engagements to contact channels.
listPagesByEngagementResponse_pages :: Lens' ListPagesByEngagementResponse [Page]

-- | The time range to lists engagements for an incident.
listEngagements_timeRangeValue :: Lens' ListEngagements (Maybe TimeRange)

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listEngagements_nextToken :: Lens' ListEngagements (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the incident you're listing
--   engagements for.
listEngagements_incidentId :: Lens' ListEngagements (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of engagements per page of results.
listEngagements_maxResults :: Lens' ListEngagements (Maybe Natural)

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listEngagementsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListEngagementsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listEngagementsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListEngagementsResponse Int

-- | A list of each engagement that occurred during the specified time
--   range of an incident.
listEngagementsResponse_engagements :: Lens' ListEngagementsResponse [Engagement]

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listContactChannels_nextToken :: Lens' ListContactChannels (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of contact channels per page.
listContactChannels_maxResults :: Lens' ListContactChannels (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact.
listContactChannels_contactId :: Lens' ListContactChannels Text

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listContactChannelsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListContactChannelsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listContactChannelsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListContactChannelsResponse Int

-- | A list of contact channels related to the specified contact.
listContactChannelsResponse_contactChannels :: Lens' ListContactChannelsResponse [ContactChannel]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
activateContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' ActivateContactChannel Text

-- | The code sent to the contact channel when it was created in the
--   contact.
activateContactChannel_activationCode :: Lens' ActivateContactChannel Text

-- | The response's http status code.
activateContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ActivateContactChannelResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
listTagsForResource_resourceARN :: Lens' ListTagsForResource Text

-- | The tags related to the contact or escalation plan.
listTagsForResourceResponse_tags :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The response's http status code.
listTagsForResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse Int

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
startEngagement_idempotencyToken :: Lens' StartEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
startEngagement_publicSubject :: Lens' StartEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
startEngagement_publicContent :: Lens' StartEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the incident that the engagement is part of.
startEngagement_incidentId :: Lens' StartEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact being engaged.
startEngagement_contactId :: Lens' StartEngagement Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
startEngagement_sender :: Lens' StartEngagement Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
startEngagement_subject :: Lens' StartEngagement Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
startEngagement_content :: Lens' StartEngagement Text

-- | The response's http status code.
startEngagementResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartEngagementResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the engagement.
startEngagementResponse_engagementArn :: Lens' StartEngagementResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you're
--   deactivating.
deactivateContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' DeactivateContactChannel Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deactivateContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeactivateContactChannelResponse Int

-- | Information provided by the user when the user acknowledges the page.
acceptPage_note :: Lens' AcceptPage (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the contact channel.
acceptPage_contactChannelId :: Lens' AcceptPage (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional field that Incident Manager uses to <tt>ENFORCE</tt>
--   <tt>AcceptCode</tt> validation when acknowledging an page.
--   Acknowledgement can occur by replying to a page, or when entering the
--   AcceptCode in the console. Enforcing AcceptCode validation causes
--   Incident Manager to verify that the code entered by the user matches
--   the code sent by Incident Manager with the page.
--   
--   Incident Manager can also <tt>IGNORE</tt> <tt>AcceptCode</tt>
--   validation. Ignoring <tt>AcceptCode</tt> validation causes Incident
--   Manager to accept any value entered for the <tt>AcceptCode</tt>.
acceptPage_acceptCodeValidation :: Lens' AcceptPage (Maybe AcceptCodeValidation)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a contact channel.
acceptPage_pageId :: Lens' AcceptPage Text

-- | The type indicates if the page was <tt>DELIVERED</tt> or
--   <tt>READ</tt>.
acceptPage_acceptType :: Lens' AcceptPage AcceptType

-- | The accept code is a 6-digit code used to acknowledge the page.
acceptPage_acceptCode :: Lens' AcceptPage Text

-- | The response's http status code.
acceptPageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AcceptPageResponse Int

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPageReceipts_nextToken :: Lens' ListPageReceipts (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of acknowledgements per page of results.
listPageReceipts_maxResults :: Lens' ListPageReceipts (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a specific contact
--   channel.
listPageReceipts_pageId :: Lens' ListPageReceipts Text

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPageReceiptsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPageReceiptsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of each acknowledgement.
listPageReceiptsResponse_receipts :: Lens' ListPageReceiptsResponse (Maybe [Receipt])

-- | The response's http status code.
listPageReceiptsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPageReceiptsResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
getContact_contactId :: Lens' GetContact Text

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
getContactResponse_displayName :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetContactResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the contact or escalation plan.
getContactResponse_contactArn :: Lens' GetContactResponse Text

-- | The alias of the contact or escalation plan. The alias is unique and
--   identifiable.
getContactResponse_alias :: Lens' GetContactResponse Text

-- | The type of contact, either <tt>PERSONAL</tt> or <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
getContactResponse_type :: Lens' GetContactResponse ContactType

-- | Details about the specific timing or stages and targets of the
--   escalation plan or engagement plan.
getContactResponse_plan :: Lens' GetContactResponse Plan

-- | The ID of the engagement to a contact channel.
describePage_pageId :: Lens' DescribePage Text

-- | The time that the contact channel acknowledged the engagement.
describePageResponse_readTime :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
describePageResponse_publicSubject :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
describePageResponse_publicContent :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the contact channel received the engagement.
describePageResponse_deliveryTime :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident that engaged the contact channel.
describePageResponse_incidentId :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time the engagement was sent to the contact channel.
describePageResponse_sentTime :: Lens' DescribePageResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The response's http status code.
describePageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a contact channel.
describePageResponse_pageArn :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement that engaged the contact channel.
describePageResponse_engagementArn :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that was engaged.
describePageResponse_contactArn :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
describePageResponse_sender :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
describePageResponse_subject :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
describePageResponse_content :: Lens' DescribePageResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact that you're deleting.
deleteContact_contactId :: Lens' DeleteContact Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteContactResponse Int

-- | A list of stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages for
--   specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses these stages to
--   contact specified contacts.
updateContact_plan :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe Plan)

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
updateContact_displayName :: Lens' UpdateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan
--   you're updating.
updateContact_contactId :: Lens' UpdateContact Text

-- | The response's http status code.
updateContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateContactResponse Int

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
createContact_idempotencyToken :: Lens' CreateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
createContact_displayName :: Lens' CreateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | Adds a tag to the target. You can only tag resources created in the
--   first Region of your replication set.
createContact_tags :: Lens' CreateContact (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The short name to quickly identify a contact or escalation plan. The
--   contact alias must be unique and identifiable.
createContact_alias :: Lens' CreateContact Text

-- | To create an escalation plan use <tt>ESCALATION</tt>. To create a
--   contact use <tt>PERSONAL</tt>.
createContact_type :: Lens' CreateContact ContactType

-- | A list of stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages that
--   contact specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses stages
--   that contact specified contacts.
createContact_plan :: Lens' CreateContact Plan

-- | The response's http status code.
createContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateContactResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created contact or escalation
--   plan.
createContactResponse_contactArn :: Lens' CreateContactResponse Text

-- | A token ensuring that the operation is called only once with the
--   specified details.
createContactChannel_idempotencyToken :: Lens' CreateContactChannel (Maybe Text)

-- | If you want to activate the channel at a later time, you can choose to
--   defer activation. Incident Manager can't engage your contact channel
--   until it has been activated.
createContactChannel_deferActivation :: Lens' CreateContactChannel (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact you are adding the
--   contact channel to.
createContactChannel_contactId :: Lens' CreateContactChannel Text

-- | The name of the contact channel.
createContactChannel_name :: Lens' CreateContactChannel Text

-- | Incident Manager supports three types of contact channels:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>SMS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>VOICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>EMAIL</pre></li>
--   </ul>
createContactChannel_type :: Lens' CreateContactChannel ChannelType

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel. The format is dependent on the type of the contact
--   channel. The following are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
createContactChannel_deliveryAddress :: Lens' CreateContactChannel ContactChannelAddress

-- | The response's http status code.
createContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateContactChannelResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
createContactChannelResponse_contactChannelArn :: Lens' CreateContactChannelResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
deleteContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' DeleteContactChannel Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteContactChannelResponse Int

-- | The name of the contact channel.
updateContactChannel_name :: Lens' UpdateContactChannel (Maybe Text)

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
updateContactChannel_deliveryAddress :: Lens' UpdateContactChannel (Maybe ContactChannelAddress)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you want to
--   update.
updateContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' UpdateContactChannel Text

-- | The response's http status code.
updateContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateContactChannelResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel you want
--   information about.
getContactChannel_contactChannelId :: Lens' GetContactChannel Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating if the contact channel has been activated
--   or not.
getContactChannelResponse_activationStatus :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse (Maybe ActivationStatus)

-- | The response's http status code.
getContactChannelResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the contact that the channel belongs to.
getContactChannelResponse_contactArn :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse Text

-- | The ARN of the contact channel.
getContactChannelResponse_contactChannelArn :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse Text

-- | The name of the contact channel
getContactChannelResponse_name :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse Text

-- | The type of contact channel. The type is <tt>SMS</tt>, <tt>VOICE</tt>,
--   or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
getContactChannelResponse_type :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse ChannelType

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
getContactChannelResponse_deliveryAddress :: Lens' GetContactChannelResponse ContactChannelAddress

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
sendActivationCode_contactChannelId :: Lens' SendActivationCode Text

-- | The response's http status code.
sendActivationCodeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SendActivationCodeResponse Int

-- | The reason that you're stopping the engagement.
stopEngagement_reason :: Lens' StopEngagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
stopEngagement_engagementId :: Lens' StopEngagement Text

-- | The response's http status code.
stopEngagementResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StopEngagementResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement you want the details
--   of.
describeEngagement_engagementId :: Lens' DescribeEngagement Text

-- | The insecure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
describeEngagementResponse_publicSubject :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the engagement started.
describeEngagementResponse_startTime :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The insecure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
describeEngagementResponse_publicContent :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the engagement ended.
describeEngagementResponse_stopTime :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident in which the engagement occurred.
describeEngagementResponse_incidentId :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeEngagementResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the escalation plan or contacts involved in the engagement.
describeEngagementResponse_contactArn :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement.
describeEngagementResponse_engagementArn :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
describeEngagementResponse_sender :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
describeEngagementResponse_subject :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
describeEngagementResponse_content :: Lens' DescribeEngagementResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
tagResource_resourceARN :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A list of tags that you are adding to the contact or escalation plan.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource [Tag]

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
untagResource_resourceARN :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The key of the tag that you want to remove.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
untagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UntagResourceResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
getContactPolicy_contactArn :: Lens' GetContactPolicy Text

-- | The ARN of the contact or escalation plan.
getContactPolicyResponse_contactArn :: Lens' GetContactPolicyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Details about the resource policy attached to the contact or
--   escalation plan.
getContactPolicyResponse_policy :: Lens' GetContactPolicyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getContactPolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetContactPolicyResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
putContactPolicy_contactArn :: Lens' PutContactPolicy Text

-- | Details of the resource policy.
putContactPolicy_policy :: Lens' PutContactPolicy Text

-- | The response's http status code.
putContactPolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutContactPolicyResponse Int

-- | Used to list only contacts who's aliases start with the specified
--   prefix.
listContacts_aliasPrefix :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe Text)

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listContacts_nextToken :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of contact. A contact is type <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an
--   escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
listContacts_type :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe ContactType)

-- | The maximum number of contacts and escalation plans per page of
--   results.
listContacts_maxResults :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe Natural)

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listContactsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListContactsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the contacts and escalation plans in your Incident Manager
--   account.
listContactsResponse_contacts :: Lens' ListContactsResponse (Maybe [Contact])

-- | The response's http status code.
listContactsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListContactsResponse Int

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPagesByContact_nextToken :: Lens' ListPagesByContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of engagements to contact channels to list per page
--   of results.
listPagesByContact_maxResults :: Lens' ListPagesByContact (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact you are retrieving
--   engagements for.
listPagesByContact_contactId :: Lens' ListPagesByContact Text

-- | The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
listPagesByContactResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPagesByContactResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listPagesByContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPagesByContactResponse Int

-- | The list of engagements to a contact's contact channel.
listPagesByContactResponse_pages :: Lens' ListPagesByContactResponse [Page]

-- | The number of minutes to wait to retry sending engagement in the case
--   the engagement initially fails.
channelTargetInfo_retryIntervalInMinutes :: Lens' ChannelTargetInfo (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
channelTargetInfo_contactChannelId :: Lens' ChannelTargetInfo Text

-- | The full name of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_displayName :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_contactArn :: Lens' Contact Text

-- | The unique and identifiable alias of the contact or escalation plan.
contact_alias :: Lens' Contact Text

-- | Refers to the type of contact. A single contact is type
--   <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
contact_type :: Lens' Contact ContactType

-- | The type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three
--   contact methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS</li>
--   <li>VOICE</li>
--   <li>EMAIL</li>
--   </ul>
contactChannel_type :: Lens' ContactChannel (Maybe ChannelType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.
contactChannel_contactChannelArn :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that contains the contact channel.
contactChannel_contactArn :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The name of the contact channel.
contactChannel_name :: Lens' ContactChannel Text

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
contactChannel_deliveryAddress :: Lens' ContactChannel ContactChannelAddress

-- | A Boolean value describing if the contact channel has been activated
--   or not. If the contact channel isn't activated, Incident Manager can't
--   engage the contact through it.
contactChannel_activationStatus :: Lens' ContactChannel ActivationStatus

-- | The format is dependent on the type of the contact channel. The
--   following are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
contactChannelAddress_simpleAddress :: Lens' ContactChannelAddress (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact.
contactTargetInfo_contactId :: Lens' ContactTargetInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value determining if the contact's acknowledgement stops the
--   progress of stages in the plan.
contactTargetInfo_isEssential :: Lens' ContactTargetInfo Bool

-- | The time that the engagement began.
engagement_startTime :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time that the engagement ended.
engagement_stopTime :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact.
engagement_incidentId :: Lens' Engagement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
engagement_engagementArn :: Lens' Engagement Text

-- | The ARN of the escalation plan or contact that Incident Manager is
--   engaging.
engagement_contactArn :: Lens' Engagement Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
engagement_sender :: Lens' Engagement Text

-- | The time that the contact channel acknowledged engagement.
page_readTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The time the message was delivered to the contact channel.
page_deliveryTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact channel.
page_incidentId :: Lens' Page (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that Incident Manager engaged the contact channel.
page_sentTime :: Lens' Page (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the page to the contact channel.
page_pageArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The ARN of the engagement that this page is part of.
page_engagementArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The ARN of the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
page_contactArn :: Lens' Page Text

-- | The user that started the engagement.
page_sender :: Lens' Page Text

-- | A list of stages that the escalation plan or engagement plan uses to
--   engage contacts and contact methods.
plan_stages :: Lens' Plan [Stage]

-- | Information provided during the page acknowledgement.
receipt_receiptInfo :: Lens' Receipt (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel Incident Manager
--   engaged.
receipt_contactChannelArn :: Lens' Receipt (Maybe Text)

-- | The type follows the engagement cycle, <tt>SENT</tt>,
--   <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, and <tt>READ</tt>.
receipt_receiptType :: Lens' Receipt ReceiptType

-- | The time receipt was <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, or
--   <tt>READ</tt>.
receipt_receiptTime :: Lens' Receipt UTCTime

-- | The time to wait until beginning the next stage. The duration can only
--   be set to 0 if a target is specified.
stage_durationInMinutes :: Lens' Stage Natural

-- | The contacts or contact methods that the escalation plan or engagement
--   plan is engaging.
stage_targets :: Lens' Stage [Target]

-- | Value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | Name of the object key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the contact channel Incident Manager is engaging.
target_channelTargetInfo :: Lens' Target (Maybe ChannelTargetInfo)

-- | Information about the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
target_contactTargetInfo :: Lens' Target (Maybe ContactTargetInfo)

-- | The start of the time range.
timeRange_startTime :: Lens' TimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The end of the time range.
timeRange_endTime :: Lens' TimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)


module Network.AWS.SSMContacts.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2021-05-03</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Systems Manager Incident Manager is an incident management console
--   designed to help users mitigate and recover from incidents affecting
--   their Amazon Web Services-hosted applications. An incident is any
--   unplanned interruption or reduction in quality of services.
--   
--   Incident Manager increases incident resolution by notifying responders
--   of impact, highlighting relevant troubleshooting data, and providing
--   collaboration tools to get services back up and running. To achieve
--   the primary goal of reducing the time-to-resolution of critical
--   incidents, Incident Manager automates response plans and enables
--   responder team escalation.
module Network.AWS.SSMContacts

-- | API version <tt>2021-05-03</tt> of the Amazon Systems Manager Incident
--   Manager Contacts SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an Amazon Web
--   Services service.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You don't have sufficient access to perform this operation.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed to due an encryption key error.
_DataEncryptionException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Updating or deleting a resource causes an inconsistent state.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Request would cause a service quota to be exceeded.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was denied due to request throttling.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Unexpected error occurred while processing the request.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Request references a resource that doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

data StartEngagement

-- | Create a value of <a>StartEngagement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:StartEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagement_idempotencyToken</a> - A token ensuring that the
--   operation is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicSubject:StartEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagement_publicSubject</a> - The insecure subject of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicContent:StartEngagement'</a>,
--   <a>startEngagement_publicContent</a> - The insecure content of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>SMS</tt>.

--   <a>startEngagement_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the incident that the
--   engagement is part of.
--

--   <a>startEngagement_contactId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the contact being engaged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:StartEngagement'</a>, <a>startEngagement_sender</a> -
--   The user that started the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:StartEngagement'</a>, <a>startEngagement_subject</a> -
--   The secure subject of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:StartEngagement'</a>, <a>startEngagement_content</a> -
--   The secure content of the message that was sent to the contact. Use
--   this field for engagements to <tt>VOICE</tt> or <tt>EMAIL</tt>.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceptPage</a> smart constructor.
data AcceptPage
AcceptPage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AcceptCodeValidation -> Text -> AcceptType -> Text -> AcceptPage

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceptPage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:note:AcceptPage'</a>, <a>acceptPage_note</a> - Information
--   provided by the user when the user acknowledges the page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:AcceptPage'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPage_contactChannelId</a> - The ARN of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptCodeValidation:AcceptPage'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPage_acceptCodeValidation</a> - An optional field that
--   Incident Manager uses to <tt>ENFORCE</tt> <tt>AcceptCode</tt>
--   validation when acknowledging an page. Acknowledgement can occur by
--   replying to a page, or when entering the AcceptCode in the console.
--   Enforcing AcceptCode validation causes Incident Manager to verify that
--   the code entered by the user matches the code sent by Incident Manager
--   with the page.
--   
--   Incident Manager can also <tt>IGNORE</tt> <tt>AcceptCode</tt>
--   validation. Ignoring <tt>AcceptCode</tt> validation causes Incident
--   Manager to accept any value entered for the <tt>AcceptCode</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageId:AcceptPage'</a>, <a>acceptPage_pageId</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptType:AcceptPage'</a>, <a>acceptPage_acceptType</a> - The
--   type indicates if the page was <tt>DELIVERED</tt> or <tt>READ</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptCode:AcceptPage'</a>, <a>acceptPage_acceptCode</a> - The
--   accept code is a 6-digit code used to acknowledge the page.
newAcceptPage :: Text -> AcceptType -> Text -> AcceptPage

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceptPageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AcceptPageResponse
AcceptPageResponse' :: Int -> AcceptPageResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceptPageResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AcceptPageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>acceptPageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newAcceptPageResponse :: Int -> AcceptPageResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPageReceipts</a> smart constructor.
data ListPageReceipts
ListPageReceipts' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListPageReceipts

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPageReceipts</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPageReceipts'</a>,
--   <a>listPageReceipts_nextToken</a> - The pagination token to continue
--   to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListPageReceipts'</a>,
--   <a>listPageReceipts_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   acknowledgements per page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageId:ListPageReceipts'</a>, <a>listPageReceipts_pageId</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement to a specific contact
--   channel.
newListPageReceipts :: Text -> ListPageReceipts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPageReceiptsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListPageReceiptsResponse
ListPageReceiptsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Receipt] -> Int -> ListPageReceiptsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPageReceiptsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:receipts:ListPageReceiptsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPageReceiptsResponse_receipts</a> - A list of each
--   acknowledgement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListPageReceiptsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPageReceiptsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newListPageReceiptsResponse :: Int -> ListPageReceiptsResponse

--   identifiable.

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePageResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   <a>$sel:readTime:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_readTime</a> - The time that the contact
--   channel acknowledged the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicSubject:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_publicSubject</a> - The insecure subject of
--   the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for
--   engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicContent:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_publicContent</a> - The insecure content of
--   the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for
--   engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryTime:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_deliveryTime</a> - The time that the contact
--   channel received the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the incident that
--   engaged the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentTime:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_sentTime</a> - The time the engagement was
--   sent to the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageArn:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_pageArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the engagement to a contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_engagementArn</a> - The ARN of the engagement
--   that engaged the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the contact that
--   was engaged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_sender</a> - The user that started the
--   engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_subject</a> - The secure subject of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:DescribePageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePageResponse_content</a> - The secure content of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
newDescribePageResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribePageResponse

--   omitted.

--   operation is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:CreateContact'</a>,
--   <a>createContact_displayName</a> - The full name of the contact or
--   escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateContact'</a>, <a>createContact_tags</a> - Adds a
--   tag to the target. You can only tag resources created in the first
--   Region of your replication set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:CreateContact'</a>, <a>createContact_alias</a> - The
--   short name to quickly identify a contact or escalation plan. The
--   contact alias must be unique and identifiable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreateContact'</a>, <a>createContact_type</a> - To
--   create an escalation plan use <tt>ESCALATION</tt>. To create a contact
--   use <tt>PERSONAL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plan:CreateContact'</a>, <a>createContact_plan</a> - A list of
--   stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages that contact
--   specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses stages that
--   contact specified contacts.
newCreateContact :: Text -> ContactType -> Plan -> CreateContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContactChannel
CreateContactChannel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> ChannelType -> ContactChannelAddress -> CreateContactChannel

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContactChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_idempotencyToken</a> - A token ensuring that
--   the operation is called only once with the specified details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deferActivation:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_deferActivation</a> - If you want to activate
--   the channel at a later time, you can choose to defer activation.
--   Incident Manager can't engage your contact channel until it has been
--   activated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_contactId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the contact you are adding the contact channel to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_name</a> - The name of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_type</a> - Incident Manager supports three
--   types of contact channels:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>SMS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>VOICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>EMAIL</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryAddress:CreateContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>createContactChannel_deliveryAddress</a> - The details that
--   Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the contact channel. The
--   format is dependent on the type of the contact channel. The following
--   are the expected formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
newCreateContactChannel :: Text -> Text -> ChannelType -> ContactChannelAddress -> CreateContactChannel

--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicSubject:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_publicSubject</a> - The insecure subject
--   of the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for
--   engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_startTime</a> - The time that the
--   engagement started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicContent:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_publicContent</a> - The insecure content
--   of the message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for
--   engagements to <tt>SMS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopTime:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_stopTime</a> - The time that the
--   engagement ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the incident
--   in which the engagement occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   escalation plan or contacts involved in the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_engagementArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_sender</a> - The user that started the
--   engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_subject</a> - The secure subject of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:DescribeEngagementResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeEngagementResponse_content</a> - The secure content of the
--   message that was sent to the contact. Use this field for engagements
--   to <tt>VOICE</tt> and <tt>EMAIL</tt>.
newDescribeEngagementResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeEngagementResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> [Tag] -> TagResource

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceARN:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceARN</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - A list of
--   tags that you are adding to the contact or escalation plan.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListContacts</a> smart constructor.
data ListContacts
ListContacts' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContactType -> Maybe Natural -> ListContacts

-- | Create a value of <a>ListContacts</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:aliasPrefix:ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_aliasPrefix</a>
--   - Used to list only contacts who's aliases start with the specified
--   prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_nextToken</a> -
--   The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_type</a> - The type
--   of contact. A contact is type <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an escalation plan
--   is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_maxResults</a> -
--   The maximum number of contacts and escalation plans per page of
--   results.
newListContacts :: ListContacts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListContactsResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   escalation plans in your Incident Manager account.

--   <a>listContactsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListContactsResponse :: Int -> ListContactsResponse

data ListPagesByContact

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPagesByContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   to the next page of results.

--   <a>listPagesByContact_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   engagements to contact channels to list per page of results.

--   <a>$sel:contactId:ListPagesByContact'</a>,
--   <a>listPagesByContact_contactId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the contact you are retrieving engagements for.

data ListPagesByContactResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPagesByContactResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   contact's contact channel.
newListPagesByContactResponse :: Int -> ListPagesByContactResponse
newtype AcceptCodeValidation
AcceptCodeValidation' :: Text -> AcceptCodeValidation
[fromAcceptCodeValidation] :: AcceptCodeValidation -> Text
pattern AcceptCodeValidation_ENFORCE :: AcceptCodeValidation
pattern AcceptCodeValidation_IGNORE :: AcceptCodeValidation
newtype AcceptType
AcceptType' :: Text -> AcceptType
[fromAcceptType] :: AcceptType -> Text
pattern AcceptType_DELIVERED :: AcceptType
pattern AcceptType_READ :: AcceptType
newtype ActivationStatus
ActivationStatus' :: Text -> ActivationStatus
[fromActivationStatus] :: ActivationStatus -> Text
pattern ActivationStatus_ACTIVATED :: ActivationStatus
pattern ActivationStatus_NOT_ACTIVATED :: ActivationStatus
newtype ChannelType
ChannelType' :: Text -> ChannelType
[fromChannelType] :: ChannelType -> Text
pattern ChannelType_EMAIL :: ChannelType
pattern ChannelType_SMS :: ChannelType
pattern ChannelType_VOICE :: ChannelType
newtype ContactType
ContactType' :: Text -> ContactType
[fromContactType] :: ContactType -> Text
pattern ContactType_ESCALATION :: ContactType
pattern ContactType_PERSONAL :: ContactType
newtype ReceiptType
ReceiptType' :: Text -> ReceiptType
[fromReceiptType] :: ReceiptType -> Text
pattern ReceiptType_DELIVERED :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_ERROR :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_READ :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_SENT :: ReceiptType
pattern ReceiptType_STOP :: ReceiptType

-- | Information about the contact channel that Incident Manager uses to
--   engage the contact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChannelTargetInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ChannelTargetInfo
ChannelTargetInfo' :: Maybe Natural -> Text -> ChannelTargetInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>ChannelTargetInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryIntervalInMinutes:ChannelTargetInfo'</a>,
--   <a>channelTargetInfo_retryIntervalInMinutes</a> - The number of
--   minutes to wait to retry sending engagement in the case the engagement
--   initially fails.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelId:ChannelTargetInfo'</a>,
--   <a>channelTargetInfo_contactChannelId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the contact channel.
newChannelTargetInfo :: Text -> ChannelTargetInfo

-- | A personal contact or escalation plan that Incident Manager engages
--   during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContact</a> smart constructor.
data Contact
Contact' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactType -> Contact

-- | Create a value of <a>Contact</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_displayName</a> - The
--   full name of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_contactArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_alias</a> - The unique and
--   identifiable alias of the contact or escalation plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Contact'</a>, <a>contact_type</a> - Refers to the type
--   of contact. A single contact is type <tt>PERSONAL</tt> and an
--   escalation plan is type <tt>ESCALATION</tt>.
newContact :: Text -> Text -> ContactType -> Contact

-- | The method that Incident Manager uses to engage a contact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactChannel</a> smart constructor.
data ContactChannel
ContactChannel' :: Maybe ChannelType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactChannelAddress -> ActivationStatus -> ContactChannel

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactChannel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ContactChannel'</a>, <a>contactChannel_type</a> - The
--   type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three contact
--   methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS</li>
--   <li>VOICE</li>
--   <li>EMAIL</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelArn:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_contactChannelArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the contact that
--   contains the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContactChannel'</a>, <a>contactChannel_name</a> - The
--   name of the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryAddress:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_deliveryAddress</a> - The details that Incident
--   Manager uses when trying to engage the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activationStatus:ContactChannel'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannel_activationStatus</a> - A Boolean value describing if
--   the contact channel has been activated or not. If the contact channel
--   isn't activated, Incident Manager can't engage the contact through it.
newContactChannel :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ContactChannelAddress -> ActivationStatus -> ContactChannel

-- | The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the
--   contact channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactChannelAddress</a> smart constructor.
data ContactChannelAddress
ContactChannelAddress' :: Maybe Text -> ContactChannelAddress

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactChannelAddress</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:simpleAddress:ContactChannelAddress'</a>,
--   <a>contactChannelAddress_simpleAddress</a> - The format is dependent
--   on the type of the contact channel. The following are the expected
--   formats:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SMS - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>VOICE - '+' followed by the country code and phone number</li>
--   <li>EMAIL - any standard email format</li>
--   </ul>
newContactChannelAddress :: ContactChannelAddress

-- | The contact that Incident Manager is engaging during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactTargetInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ContactTargetInfo
ContactTargetInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Bool -> ContactTargetInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactTargetInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:ContactTargetInfo'</a>,
--   <a>contactTargetInfo_contactId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isEssential:ContactTargetInfo'</a>,
--   <a>contactTargetInfo_isEssential</a> - A Boolean value determining if
--   the contact's acknowledgement stops the progress of stages in the
--   plan.
newContactTargetInfo :: Bool -> ContactTargetInfo

-- | Incident Manager reaching out to a contact or escalation plan to
--   engage contact during an incident.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEngagement</a> smart constructor.
data Engagement
Engagement' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Engagement

-- | Create a value of <a>Engagement</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_startTime</a> - The
--   time that the engagement began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopTime:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_stopTime</a> - The
--   time that the engagement ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_incidentId</a> - The
--   ARN of the incident that's engaging the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_engagementArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_contactArn</a> - The
--   ARN of the escalation plan or contact that Incident Manager is
--   engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:Engagement'</a>, <a>engagement_sender</a> - The user
--   that started the engagement.
newEngagement :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Engagement

-- | Incident Manager engaging a contact's contact channel.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPage</a> smart constructor.
data Page
Page' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Page

-- | Create a value of <a>Page</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:readTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_readTime</a> - The time that the
--   contact channel acknowledged engagement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_deliveryTime</a> - The time
--   the message was delivered to the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:incidentId:Page'</a>, <a>page_incidentId</a> - The ARN of the
--   incident that's engaging the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentTime:Page'</a>, <a>page_sentTime</a> - The time that
--   Incident Manager engaged the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_pageArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the page to the contact channel.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engagementArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_engagementArn</a> - The ARN
--   of the engagement that this page is part of.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactArn:Page'</a>, <a>page_contactArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sender:Page'</a>, <a>page_sender</a> - The user that started
--   the engagement.
newPage :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Page

-- | The stages that an escalation plan or engagement plan engages contacts
--   and contact methods in.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlan</a> smart constructor.
data Plan
Plan' :: [Stage] -> Plan

-- | Create a value of <a>Plan</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stages:Plan'</a>, <a>plan_stages</a> - A list of stages that
--   the escalation plan or engagement plan uses to engage contacts and
--   contact methods.
newPlan :: Plan

-- | Records events during an engagement.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReceipt</a> smart constructor.
data Receipt
Receipt' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReceiptType -> POSIX -> Receipt

-- | Create a value of <a>Receipt</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptInfo:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptInfo</a> -
--   Information provided during the page acknowledgement.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactChannelArn:Receipt'</a>,
--   <a>receipt_contactChannelArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the contact channel Incident Manager engaged.
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptType:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptType</a> - The
--   type follows the engagement cycle, <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>,
--   and <tt>READ</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:receiptTime:Receipt'</a>, <a>receipt_receiptTime</a> - The
--   time receipt was <tt>SENT</tt>, <tt>DELIVERED</tt>, or <tt>READ</tt>.
newReceipt :: ReceiptType -> UTCTime -> Receipt

-- | A set amount of time that an escalation plan or engagement plan
--   engages the specified contacts or contact methods.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStage</a> smart constructor.
data Stage
Stage' :: Natural -> [Target] -> Stage

-- | Create a value of <a>Stage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInMinutes:Stage'</a>, <a>stage_durationInMinutes</a> -
--   The time to wait until beginning the next stage. The duration can only
--   be set to 0 if a target is specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:Stage'</a>, <a>stage_targets</a> - The contacts or
--   contact methods that the escalation plan or engagement plan is
--   engaging.
newStage :: Natural -> Stage

-- | A container of a key-value name pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Value of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Name of the object key.
newTag :: Tag

-- | The contact or contact channel that's being engaged.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTarget</a> smart constructor.
data Target
Target' :: Maybe ChannelTargetInfo -> Maybe ContactTargetInfo -> Target

-- | Create a value of <a>Target</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channelTargetInfo:Target'</a>, <a>target_channelTargetInfo</a>
--   - Information about the contact channel Incident Manager is engaging.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactTargetInfo:Target'</a>, <a>target_contactTargetInfo</a>
--   - Information about the contact that Incident Manager is engaging.
newTarget :: Target

-- | A range of between two set times
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data TimeRange
TimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> TimeRange

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeRange</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_startTime</a> - The
--   start of the time range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:TimeRange'</a>, <a>timeRange_endTime</a> - The end of
--   the time range.
newTimeRange :: TimeRange
